name: Midpoint  Moncton, Saint John, Fredericton OPEN
description: Pleasant-View offers inn-style accommodation for those who want to see the best of rural  New Brunswick.  We provide breakfast and cosy, double-bed rooms.  If you are a group travelling, we can offer our kitchen and dining room on request.  Please indicate in a message if required.  Internet access free and lots of space to unwind after a day on the road or a hike through Fundy Park.  Right at Hatfield Point Wharf, where boat launching is easy, we have kayaks and a canoe.
neighborhood_overview: Belleisle Bay is a hidden gem in southwestern New Brunswick.  It is a fiord surrounded by farms and opportunities to explore the countryside.  It is at the north east end of Stonehammer Geopark with the fossilized forests of Norton nearby.  One of the treats is the Belleisle Marsh Walking Trail, less than a kilometre from our doorstep.  Martins, beavers, winter birds abound there, a photographer`s dream.

name: Near Fundy - Country Guest House All Seasons!
description: Get a good night's sleep at best value in region.  Enjoy simple rooms in a rustic inn on Belleisle Bay at Hatfield Pt. Ideal as a getaway, near winery, waterfalls, great hiking, winter and summer sports.  Our kayaks are yours to use at no cost.  Groups welcome and we have a large, private kitchen and dining area where you can prepare your own meals.  Backpackers and workers on local contracts will enjoy the ambience.  Please read House Manual.
neighborhood_overview: Belleisle is one of the most serene locations in New Brunswick.  A fiord like bay, with rolling hills and working farms, waterfalls, wildlife, old graveyards, all sports and game.  Beautiful birds in the marsh. Picturesque ferries, artisans.  Two wineries within easy drives.  Or just sit on the porch in a rocker.

name: Harris Hatch - Starfish
description: St. Andrews by the Sea. These cozy and convenient beach themed suites are at ground level and newly renovated. Located in the heart of St. Andrews By-the-Sea!  Loads of space. Fresh and open.  Each unit sleeps 4 (Queen bed, single bed , plus sofa bed).
neighborhood_overview: Our guests often comment on the quiet neighbourhood and that everything is within walking distance. The commercial district has a distinctive character and appearance, scarcely changed since the 1800s. The wares being offered here, however, have changed - today you will find a diverse selection of interesting goods. From quality apparel to artisanal gifts with a local flavour, there is something for everyone.
host_about: Andrew and I first visited in St. Andrews, NB in the late 1980's and loved the charm, history, and natural beauty of the area.  We raised two children. Boston is only a 6-hour drive and one of our favourite cities. St. Andrews has the classic east coast feel with historical buildings, friendly people, and plenty to do.

description: Beautiful, Spacious, 4 bedroom - main level home had 1 large 4 piece bathroom, four bedrooms with their own private powder room; 3 living areas, 12 place setting dining table and a large laundry rm. neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Gatherings Guest House is on 1.25 acres, parking for 8 located on the beautiful Saint John River Valley just a few minutes from Fredericton, New Brunswick's capital. The views along the Saint John River Valley are lovely our home is situated on a 1 1/4 acre lot of land so there is lots of room and open space to relax and enjoy the outdoor space and the neighbourhood is very quiet and safe. Being the capital of the province our city has no industrial manufacturing so our air is very fresh and clean for you to enjoy while you relax on your vacation while you stay with us.
Just a few Kilometres up river we have a Mactaquac provincial park that has an 18 hole golf course, provincial camping, a marina and a swimming.
There are three more golf courses in this are they are; Kingswood, Fredericton Golf club and they also have an indoor curling club and carman creek golf course.

We have two lovely black Labradors and we all love to spend time in this beautiful space on the water!

name: Cedar Paradise on Lotus Pond
description: Luxurious peaceful rustic wooden chalet surrounded by nature and wildlife on the edge of a tranquil natural pond next to a private sandy beach on the Atlantic ocean.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a picturesque postcard considered to be a beach community with many public provincial beaches, parks, sand dunes, forests, wildlife, parks, nature walking trails and boardwalks. In the area within 15 minutes of this location, you can also find a fish market, grocery store, gas station, boat marina, seafood restaurants and take-outs, bike rental, tourist office, leather shop, public library and there is also a 18 hole golf course 5 minutes away and a water park, casino, movie theatre,minature golf, zoo, butterfly sanctuary 30 minutes away. I would be happy to be your guide and advisor to the area, answering all your questons and giving you suggestions to maximize your experience during your stay.
host_about: The best way to describe my life is travel, adventure and being of service to others. The best way to describe myself is an eccentric world traveler, documentarian, humanitarian, alchemist, explorer who is in search for the truth and not a slave to the illusion of the system. I'm an open-minded and friendly guy who has been traveling the world for the past 26 years through 168 countries on 6 continents, from the roof of Africa on Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania, through the jungles of south-east Asia to the southern tip of Patagonia on Tierra del Fuego. This lifestyle has allowed me to share the love of many cultures, religions and races around the world. Always in motion to explore the splendors of our planet with a never-ending, ever-changing magnificent views and realities. I started my journey in 1988 and haven't looked back to the illusion. I am attracted to adventure, nature, cultural diversity, history, architecture, wildlife, anthropology and unique customs. My motivation for this choice of lifestyle is to experience, learn and meet as many people while witnessing as many traditional activities as I can during my life time. At the same time, my true passion is my humanitarian work supporting people in third world countries with education, water, food, medicine, business creation, life necessities and love. My main goal is to create a bridge from the developed world to the impoverished people of the world, creating equality and opportunity. Being a citizen of the world gives you the feeling of being connected to the entire planet and having a real understanding of the people who live on it makes you feel so appreciative to be alive and thankful to be apart of it. It makes you realize the whole world is our home and we are all family in it. This is why I am opening up my home to other travelers to stay while expanding my international network of friends. If you really want to know who I am and what I do, check out my documentaries on my Youtube channel at SELIM FEHMI OZCAN or my photos on my private website at True MyEyes. I hope our paths will cross someday somewhere in this world.

name: Fully stocked cottage, kayaks for 8, sleeps 10+
description:
"The Old Potter Homestead" is only minutes to Kouchibouguac National Park and borders on the Kouchibouguac River.

name: The Church House - a unique cottage experience
description:
The CHURCH HOUSE is located in Bayfield, NEW BRUNSWICK !!!!

Newly renovated historic church (built 1883) converted into a unique cottage. only minutes away from the wonderful sandy beaches of Cape Tormentine and the Confederation Bridge (toll bridge- approx. $55.00 to come back to NB)

We are on the NEW BRUNSWICK side!!!!!!!

Parties and events are not allowed on Airbnb listings.

neighborhood_overview: The Church House is located only a few minutes from Cape Jourimain Nature Centre (hiking area, explore bird live), the Confederation Bridge, and Provincial Tourism Centres. Ideal location for day trips to explore PEI, the Hopewell Rocks having one of the highest tides in the world, the Moncton region and Nova Scotia.  Minutes away to the Cape Tormentine sandy beach, general Stores for groceries, restaurants, gas, coffe and ice cream. Buy fresh lobsters right off the boats at Murray Corner or Cape Tormentine wharves or from local fish markets.

name: Cottage Chic Loft- Downtown 2 Bedroom - Water View
description: Two bedroom, two level apartment on Historic Water Street, St. Andrews by-the-Sea. Located in an 1860's building above a shop in the heart of the commercial district, this newly renovated apartment has water views, a full kitchen, living space with dining area, and bathroom on the first level. The second level has two bedrooms - one with a king bed and the other with two twins. Perfect for one or two couples, a girls getaway or a family with children over the age of 8 (no exceptions). No pets.
neighborhood_overview:
2016 Great Places in Canada Winner – Great Street

Water Street has been the heart and soul of commercial and community life in St. Andrews by-the-Sea for over 200 years – the focal point for its 1,800 residents and 80,000 annual visitors.

Historic Water Street is a part of the community of St. Andrews’ heart and identity. The pedestrian-oriented street integrates contextual urban design with open spaces and scenic views of the nearby sea. While the street’s design and architecture references the community’s over 200 years of history, the place itself has evolved to remain a daily part of residents' lives for both commercial and recreational purposes. The street is also an attraction for the community’s over 80,000 visitors each year. It houses well-frequented restaurants, shops, galleries, and other excursion opportunities. The street is also the backdrop for a weekly Farmers Market and hosts community events in all four seasons.

name: Down the Road Guesthouse
description:
Welcome to Down the Road Guesthouse, your perfect base for exploring the Bay of Fundy’s highest tides in the world.

Located just minutes from the Rocks Provincial Park, our historic five bedroom, two bath home has been in our family for more than 150 years, longer than Canada has been a country. It was completely renovated in 2017 while keeping the country character of the home. All prices include tax.
neighborhood_overview:
The best part of the area is that it sits between two beautiful nature parks. The Hopewell Rocks Provincial Park is just a few minutes away while Fundy National Park is about a half-hour down a scenic country highway.

For outdoor lovers, hiking, swimming, zip lining, kayaking and some of the most dramatic views on Canada’s east coast are just around the corner.

There are also several small museums in the area including a historic jail and courthouse.

Moncton, the hub of Canada’s Maritime region, is a short drive away, with an international airport, fine dining and some of the best shopping in the Atlantic region.

The nearby Village of Hillsborough features a small selection of groceries, gas, and restaurants, while Alma, (30 km or 18 miles away) is the gateway to Fundy Park, with some of the best seafood our region has to offer. This is another great spot to see the power of tides.

name: Easy from U.S. or P.Q. Borders-  Open in Winter!
description: Stay on the beautiful Belleisle.  Pleasant-View was the first tavern in Kings County dating from the early eighteen hundreds.  It is no longer a tavern but we have good beds, a great view and coffee in the AM.  You may find noseeums, spiders and moths in the hot weather. There are no street lights, only stars.  If you want to cook, we have a  private area on the ground level.  An example of shabby chic and great place to start your Atlantic coast visit.
neighborhood_overview: This area of New Brunswick is part of the UNESCO Stonehammer Geopark.  It is rural with a lot of Loyalist history.  Check your genealogy before you come because almost everyone who came to the east side of North American travelled through our countryside for a new life.

name: Lavender Manor. Minutes from Beach!
description:
Situated on NB's east coast, renowned for it's warm sandy beaches, this exquisite home with all the comforts, has views of the ocean & lavender fields. Set on 100 acres & only 2 min drive to beach, there's lots of walking, biking & snowshoeing trails all connecting to groomed snowmobile trails.
Perfect for summer vacations, weekend getaways, special occasions, snowmobiling or cycling excursions. Experience privacy & tranquility while still enjoying comfort & being close to many destinations.
neighborhood_overview: Saint Edouard-de-Kent is a picturesque fishing village, adjoining Bouctouche, on NB's Acadian Coastal Drive, renowned for its beautiful destinations & sandy beaches with waters the warmest north of the Carolinas! Indulge in fresh seafood and the art & culture this area has to offer. The house overlooks NB's first Lavender Farm with views of the Northumberland Strait. Bring your fishing rod &catch fresh mackeral right off the wharf; dig for clams along the shoreline; enjoy water activities such as swimming, boating or windsurfing; enjoy the amazing bike & snowmobile trails with spectacular views; or just sit back, relax & unwind.

name: Adventure Cottage
description:
This modernized cottage is nestled in the woods near the Kouchibouguac National Park. The perfect retreat from your day of adventures in the surrounding trails. The two bedrooms, allow you privacy and space! Our guests can enjoy convenient access to the Kouchibouguac National Park directly from our site, including terrain for hikers, and cyclists. There are endless trails for ATVs. Cross-country skiing, snowshoeing and snowmobiling are popular activities in winter!

Year round availability!

A nature wonderland! Beaches and dunes nearby. Most notably - Kelly’s beach, a 8 km long stretch of gorgeous sand, with the warmest water north of Virginia, USA. Starting right at your cottage!
Centrally located between Miramichi and Moncton. Only a drive away to Richibucto (Wharf) , Rexton, (Bonar Law Museum), Bouctouche (Dune), Le Pays de la Sagouine, Shediac and the Confederation Bridge.
Our guests can enjoy convenient access to the Kouchibouguac National Park directly from our site, including terrain for hikers, and cyclists. There are endless trails for ATVs. Cross-country skiing, snowshoeing and snowmobiling are popular activities in winter!

name: Beach House at Parlee Beach
description: 5 minute walk to Parlee Beach in Beautiful Pointe-du-Chêne.  Open concept kitchen has everything you will need.  Guests can enjoy dining on the back deck or inside at our large dining table.  The screened porch on the front is fantastic for games in the evening and coffee in the morning. Our grass backyard has a fire pit for enjoying a campfire.  AIR CONDITIONING, internet TV’s, wifi, sound system, washer and dryer, beach chairs & toys, and parking for two cars complete the experience.
neighborhood_overview:
Wetlands and beach are at the end of our street, about a 1 minute walk, and Parlee beach provincial park is a 5 minute easy walk away. Parlee beach is a great place to take a walk or enjoy the sun. We have all the beach stuff for you to borrow - chairs, boards, sand toys, umbrella, towels. You’ll be amazed at the variety of activities offered at this provincial park, including a lifeguarded swimming beach, volleyball courts, restaurant and canteen.

The Town of Shediac is a 5 minute drive, 10 minute bike ride, or 25 min walk away. It is known as the Lobster Capital of Canada and is home of the World's Largest Lobster as well as wonderful restaurants, grocery stores, and the famous Sunday market.

There are more than 12 kilometres of trails and bike paths nearby and we have a selection of bikes and helmets for you to borrow. The downturn Shediac to Pointe-du-Chêne trail follows an old railbed out to a walking bridge over a cove in Shediac Bay. The cove is a 2

name: Seaside Cottage - Near Parlee Beach & Shediac
description:
Spacious and charming three (3) bedroom cottage. Fully furnished including all dishware, cooking appliances, linens & towels, unlimited use of Netflix, Wi-Fi, BBQ, dishwasher and washer and dryer.
The cottage is conveniently located in a quiet neighbourhood in Cap-Bimet. A five (5) minute walk to a stunning private beach and a two (2) minute walk to Paturel's Shore House restaurant where you can view the beautiful sunset.

Furthermore, only a 5-7 min drive to downtown Shediac and Parlee Beach.
neighborhood_overview:
A five to seven (5-7) minute drive to downtown Shediac, where you will find shopping, lots of restaurants, a grocery store, the Giant Lobster, Homarus Eco-Centre, Parlee Beach Provincial Park, Shediac Farmer’s Market, Neptune Drive-in, a medical clinic etc. Furthermore, only twenty (20) minutes to Moncton and the airport.

There are also lots of day trip opportunities such as Le Pays de la Sagouine in Bouctouche, Hopewell Rocks, Magic Mountain Water Park, Magnetic Hill Zoo. Close to the Bay of Fundy, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia.

name: Darlene's Country Cottage
description:
Darlene’s Country Cottage is a 3 1/2 bedroom, air-conditioned rustic cottage nestled on a country road in Blackville in the Miramichi Region of New Brunswick.

NEW: Updated WIFI as of Sept. 2024. A new service provider has come to our rural area and we are pleased to offer high-speed cable internet, and Rogers cable TV at the cottage.

This cottage rental is perfect if you’re looking for a vacation place that feels like home. Families, fishermen, tubers, long stays and one-nighters are welcome!
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage for rent, is on a quiet country road just minutes from the Village of Blackville and the majestic Miramichi River. In Blackville you’ll find all the amenities you need such as a grocery store, hardware store, pharmacy, health clinic, and restaurants.

Activities available nearby include tubing, canoe rentals, kayaking, fly-fishing, and paddle boarding. Take a drive or a walk and explore the great outdoors! Discover beautiful views of the Miramichi river, hiking trails, hidden waterfalls, a covered bridge and more in the Miramichi Region. The nearby community park in Blackville overlooks the river and has a boat launch, trails, picnic areas, splashpad and a playground.
host_about: I am a former chef who loves to cook for my family. I enjoy sewing, quilting, knitting and collecting antiques.

name: Authentic Bay of Fundy Beachside home St. Martins
description:
Welcome to our stunning 3 bedroom vacation home in the scenic village of St. Martins New Brunswick.
Enjoy incredible ocean views from your private beachside deck.
This spacious 3 bedroom home offers a 4 piece washroom and an open concept kitchen/ living room with ocean views and 3 exits to the wrap around deck. Private laundry room with extra single bed and use of large BBQ are also included. steps to beaches, restaurants , grocer+

Come join us for a fantastic experience on the Bay of Fundy.
neighborhood_overview:
We are steps away from a great beach on the Bay of Fundy.
Next Door is Coastal Tides restaurant and accross the street is Old Molly's Bar and also the Beach Street inn with Periwinkles restaurant and bar. You will find more restaurants, a Seafood Market, a Local grocer and butcher , liquor store, museum and much more all within 2 kms of the house.
1 km away you will find 2 covered bridges and the harbor where you can watch the fisherman arrive with the daily catch.
2 kms away is the famous Sea caves ready to be explored at low tide.
4 kms away is , west Quaco lighthouse with a spectacular view of Dulse Rock.
8 kms away is the beginning of the FundyTrail provincial park consisting of many kms of walking/bicycle trails and a road you can drive to spectacular views , beaches , waterfalls, a suspension bridge and wonderful guest center.
25 minutes to Saint John airport.
45 minutes to uptown Saint John and harbor.
1.5 hours to hopewell Rocks.
host_about:
Hello , I am Pat and I love St. Martins and the Bay of Fundy. 
I manage several incredible vacation homes here  in St. Martins and West Quaco.
I manage...
Authentic Bay of Fundy Beachside Home ,Waters Edge Bay of Fundy, Rosehill Cottage by the Sea Caves and Homestead -Gateway to the Fundy Trail.
I also opperate a custom Woodworking store - Authentic Bay of Fundy store/studio specializing in one of a kind charcuterie boards and Laser engraving located at 15 Beach Street.
We are excited to share the incredible village of St. Martins with our guests and hope to provide the ideal vacation experience.

We understand the variety of vacation styles that may appeal to different groups and hope to provide the best experience to suit each groups needs.

We plan to offer our guests all the privacy wanted when renting a vacation home or cottage but we also want to be available for any information , recommendations or to help arrange the perfect excursions or personalised souvenirs/gifts.. so feel free to reach out to me.
We look forward to having you as our guests here in beautiful St. Martins New Brunswick.

name: Grand Falls /Sault NB Home Rental in the Country
description:
The Gillespie Homestead, overlooks the St John River Valley where wild creatures roam. Feel the warmth of yesteryears and spend hours on the front porch hearing the tales….
A short 8km to Grand Falls New Brunswick Canada or 3 km to Limestone, Maine USA. You can rent Kayaks, electric bikes and side by sides ; lots of trails to explore!
Great place to hold family gatherings; build a camp fire under endless skies, huge lawn for team sports ; large kitchen for a cooking challenge or barbecue!
neighborhood_overview: Quiet  Safe  in a perfect picture Country setting
host_about:
I enjoy meeting people and sharing my home town’s  natural beauty and it’s citizen who keep it safe and clean. 

I returned home after spending 40 years in Nova Scotia raising my family. 

We are blessed in Atlantic Canada with such a diverse landscape within  a small section of Canada. 

Being of Keltic  descent, I love to tell stories with lots of passion! Never let the truth get in the way of a good story  they say……….

name: Leez Vacation Rentals
description:
This lovely and cozy house is located just minutes from downtown Shediac, New Brunswick, the Lobster Capital of the World.

In the summer time, cracking open a juicy lobster is just the beginning of your stay in Shediac… a vacation paradise for people of all tastes!

In the winter time, you can just walk behind this cozy house and get to the Shediac arena on the next street in just minutes to get to your kids' hockey tournaments or just enjoy family skating and many more winter attractions!
neighborhood_overview:
Approximately 5 minutes away by car, you will be able to take a dip at the famous Parlee Beach Provincial Park, one of North America's finest beaches and home of the warmest salt water in Canada. With waters peaking at 24 degrees Celcius (75 degrees Fahrenheit), it is the warmest water north of Virginia. This park also includes a supervised swimming beach, volleyball, ultimate Frisbee, football, a sand-sculpture competition, and daily scheduled sports activities.

Two marinas are also situated in the Shediac area; the downtown Shediac Bay Yatch Club Marina and the Point du Chêne Marina where you can rent boats, visit boutiques and the Homarus Eco-Centre, fish on the wharf with the locals, and purchase boat cruises.
host_about: Hello everyone, I am offering a quiet place in downtown of Shediac . I will be there for you, to be sure that your stay will be as good it could be!!

Two wineries within easy drives.  Or just sit on the porch in a rocker.

neighborhood_overview:
Grand Barachois is a quaint community making it a great place to unwind and enjoy the quieter side of life.

Close by has the following:

* A well stocked grocery store for all your needs (Grand-Barachois Valu Foods) about 5-7 min (2km) drive from the cottage.
* A French Catholic Church (Église paroissiale catholique de St-Henri).
* The town of Shediac, world famous lobster capital of the world. Shediac also has a drive in theatres as well as several restaurants. You can also take a cruise with Croisières Shediac Bay Cruises.
* Three large public beaches (Parlee Breach, Sandy Beach and Les Aboiteaux Beach).
* Several restaurants within driving distance that offer many local and seafood dishes.

Twenty to thirty minutes drive will take you to Moncton. Moncton has a shopping center called, Champlain Mall which is a good size shopping centre for your shopping needs. Moncton also has several restaurants as well as a local theatre (
host_about:
I live in Ontario but originally from New Brunswick. 
I love to travel and discover new places and try new foods. 
I hope you will find my cottage to be a great place to relax and rejuvenate from the fast pace of  life.

name: King River View Suite Historic Inn
description: Historic Governor's Mansion riverside inn museum with comfortable guest rooms. Quiet location with spectacular views. Ideal location for those who seek a personalized and unique experience at an independent family-owned property that has been in operation for more than 45 years. Former timber baron estate. This two-bedroom suite has a king bed in one room and two twin beds in the other and a kitchenette.  If you appreciate history and culture, our place is for you! Note:  Price includes all tax.
neighborhood_overview: Governor's Mansion is located right on the Miramichi River at the point where the river splits at Beaubears Island National Park forming the Northwest Miramichi and the Southwest Miramichi.  Spectacular sunsets are common and free. We are located in the former village of Nelson.  The City of Miramichi is made up of many former villages and towns.  There is no "one" downtown but several commercial areas.  We are located in a attractive, quiet neighbourhood. You can walk and cycle along the river.
host_about: Retired United Nations staff member enjoys meeting others.  Appreciate history and heritage.

name: Superbe au coeur de Caraquet
description: Beautiful large accommodation in the middle of Caraquet. Ideal for family reunions, groups and visiting or last minute professionals. All right next to the bakery, gas station, bike path and snowmobile trails, walking distance to several restaurants and services.  Close to the beaches, as well as activities specific to our beautiful region: fishing, golf, cycling, outdoor centre, festivals, events, Acadian historic village and more : )
neighborhood_overview:
Caraquet, a quality of life envied by all
Caraquet is the perfect mix of social, tourist, economic and cultural life, facing a beautiful and breathtaking natural setting: the Bay of Caraquet which becomes, in the center of the city, the Bay of Chaleurs.

Caraquet is the unprecedented mix of a warm, legendary and friendly welcome with the modernity of services in all areas. Good tables, friendly accommodations, unique tourist entertainment and leading business centers are just some of the exceptional services you'll find here.

Caraquet is the tranquility of a city with all the main services that can be found in large urban centers. Caraquet is Acadian festival, Acadian pride, Acadian hospitality, Acadian simplicity, Acadian knowledge, Acadian openness, Acadian desire, Acadian strength, Acadian delicacy, Acadian flavor.

Caraquet is Caraquet. Simply.

name: Central place next to highway smarttv+netflix+wifi
description: Nice cozy apartment, in the vicinity of the highway (2 minutes driving), next to services and many touristic attractions (gas stations, restaurants, hospital, shopping centers, casinos, skiing, cycling trails, snowmobile trails, botanical garden) and to the University of Moncton-Edmundston Campus, located in a very solid and quiet building, adding to your comfort and good night sleep.
neighborhood_overview: Tim Hortons, Jean Coutu, Boston Pizza, Shoppers Drugmart, McDonald's, Chinese Buffet, Subway, Jeweler Store, NB Liquor, PFK, Petro Canada, all in walking distance
host_about:
Our apartments are located in Edmundston, the perfect place to stop along the way of your travel, nestled between sparkling rivers and mountains weathered by time. Having our roots on the "old" continent, we are anxious  to share with our guests a part of European tradition, culture and hospitality. 
We love to travel, to see new places, to meet new people, to share experiences, to learn, to find out, to discover. 
We appreciate the German seriousness and correctness, we enjoy the Italian culture and gastronomy, we will be forever in love with the cosmopolitan air of Bucharest.  
The fact that we have lived in many places in different countries has given us the opportunity to understand different cultures and ways of life, which is extremely useful in this new challenge.

name: THE CAPTAIN'S HOUSE-DEER ISLAND-WATERFRONT
description:
This house was built by Captain George W. Cook in early 1800s. He was the Captain of a merchant sailing vessel called the Jed F. Duren. a large vessel at 112 tons. Two of Captain George W Cook's original navigation maps are mounted in the house. The home is reminiscent of days of sea and sail. The house is really cool and the waterfront and sunrise views are amazing!

This century home meets today's standards of comfort and safety. It is now owned by a Captain Parker - a local lobster fisherman.
neighborhood_overview: Deer Island - 20 min ferry ride from Letete NB ( 15 min outside of St. George) - ferry access to Campobello Island and short drive from there to Eastport, ME.
host_about: I was born and raised on PEI - left the Island for school and work and now I am returning and have set up a little vacation rental business to keep me busy when I retire in 5-7 years. I have tourism and hospitality in my DNA and love giving you the best vacation experience - starting with your accommodations. My grandparents owned Ocean View Cottages in Cavendish and my first "job" was cleaning cottages and my last "job" will probably be cleaning cottages. My grandmother Nellie McCoubrey Brookins taught me well and I assure you your cottage will be everything you expect it to be and then some. See you at the shore!

name: Black Barn Family Beach House
description: The Black Barn offers a perfect retreat for unwinding on the deck while grilling burgers, sipping wine or coffee on the Main bedroom balcony, roasting s'mores over the campfire, cycling or strolling along the trail that links up with the property, or taking a dip in the ocean after a leisurely walk down to the beach. And be sure not to miss the breathtaking sunset over the water.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is great! There is a beach just a short walk away, accessible by a walking path behind the house. All other amenities are only a quick drive away, yet when at the cottage, you can enjoy some peace and tranquility.

Shediac, being the Lobster Capital, is a mere 8 mins drive and you will find local shops, restaurants, the Point du Chene Wharf, ice cream shops, coffee shops, and of course the fish markets where you can buy your lobster and other fresh seafood. There is also an outdoor farmer’s market in Shediac every Sunday morning during the summer.

Please note there are neighbours in close proximity on one side of the house. Please follow local bylaws regarding quiet time after 11 p.m.

name: Jacksons by the Bay
description: Cute one story recently renovated home in the heart of St.Martins.  This home features a back deck with view of the bay of fundy, BBQ, an fire pit for family campfires.  Walking distance to local amenities and the beach.  When at the cottage enjoy all its extras including a lower level full of entertainment such as a air hockey,  fooseball & a card table.  Also in the lower level is a large smart tv, numerous board games an books for your enjoyment & relaxation.
neighborhood_overview: St Martins is a beautiful village to stroll through enjoy the nearby beaches & caves. If traveling to the caves or Browns beach I would recommend low tide. During hightide enjoy kayaking or stroll through our historic bridges & little shops. Take a trip to the Fundy Trail this provincial park is a gem an the beauty is bountiful but make sure you have the better part of the day there is just so much to see Walton Gorge, Interpretation center, suspension bridge, several beaches (long beach my personal favorite) and so many look outs of the coastline. I would recommend bringing a picnic lunch as picnic tables are placed strategically so guests can enjoy the view while they eat or simply rest. The great thing about the trail is everyone can enjoy its beaty regardless of mobility. So many more day trip close by as well but if you chose to stay in the cottage & chill the home has comfy loungers & chairs at your disposal.

name: Charming Modern Waterfront Cottage
description:
This 4 bedrooms hideaway is situated on the River Of Fire, the beautiful Richibucto River. "A flamboyant red sky that mirrored in the water" is how it was described and got it's name. Amazing sunsets!
Right on the river, full windows facing the river to give you the best possible views, plus two full patios.
This newly built open concept has it all.
There are two kayaks on the premises to go explore the many waterways along the Richibucto river and access to the dock.
June-Sept, Sunday book in
neighborhood_overview:
Brown’s Yard is cottage country and it comes to life in the summer. We have a wonderful farmers market in Bass River, minutes away. The Richibucto winery, which is just up the road, give tours and samples.
You won’t find a friendlier place than this but if you’re looking to get away from it all, it’s still perfect.
host_about: Love the great outdoors, travel and meeting people.

name: Sea Breeze Cottage- Cave View Cottages
description:
Nestled by the iconic Sea Caves, a short drive leads you to the breathtaking Fundy Trail Provincial Park. Embrace outdoor adventures with hiking, kayaking, and the unique experience of exploring the ocean floor during low tide.
Conveniently, the beach and restaurants are a mere 2-minute walk away. Built in the 1880s, this house exudes charm with its wide wooden floorboards and plaster walls upstairs—a timeless retreat for those seeking a touch of history and coastal allure.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover proximity to the sea caves, a variety of restaurants, and a quick drive to the scenic Fundy Trail Provincial Park. Nestled in a serene neighborhood, you'll experience tranquility, although distant sounds from the sea caves and restaurants add a unique ambiance. Enjoy the best of both worlds—a private location in a quiet setting while being close to everything. Note that, come October, many local restaurants take a seasonal pause, enhancing the peaceful atmosphere of the area.

Exciting news! We are proud owners of the Blue Whale cottage next door and the captivating lighthouse cottage perched on the hill. Whether you choose the coastal charm of the Blue Whale or the elevated retreat at the lighthouse, both properties offer unique experiences while ensuring your comfort and enjoyment. We look forward to hosting you in these neighboring havens.
host_about:
I’m a teacher and now own three cottages!  The lighthouse cottage was a dream that just recently came to fruition.  I still can’t believe it!

Owning a cottage in St. Martins has always been a dream of mine and I can’t believe how popular they have become.   I have been coming here since I was a child, and been a full-time resident in the summertime since 2013.

name: Beach Glass House
description: Beach Glass House is situated in the village of North Head on Grand Manan.  It faces the idyllic Stanley Beach, the iconic Swallowtail Lighthouse, and the bustling wharves of both the ferry and local fishermen. A short walk down the lane deposits you on to Stanley Beach. Enjoy relaxation in a friendly, convenient, and serene location. You won't want to leave!
neighborhood_overview: Your stay at Beach Glass House is a quintessential Grand Manan experience.  Wake up in the morning with your coffee on the deck and observe as the fishermen leave the North Head Wharf for their long days at sea.  Tell time throughout the day by the comings and goings of the Grand Manan ferries.  For breakfast journey up to the North Head Bakery for fresh French pastries, the best on the island (open in late June-October). Watch as the Bay of Fundy molds the landscape every 6 hours with the world's largest tidal fluctuations. You can take all of this in while walking Stanley Beach, combing the sand for a variety of ocean treasures and its bounty of sea glass.  Bring your kayaks and launch from Stanley Beach to enjoy some of the hidden spots on Grand Manan.  A menagerie of birds call this island home waiting for you to spot them. At night, watch Swallowtail Lighthouse call the fishermen home.  Post Office Pizza, Convenience/Drug store, children's park, hospital, local shops, hiking, chur
host_about: Fellow Airbnb Host with multiple locations.  Love exploring with my wife and 3 children.

name: The Johnville Guest House - lovely, private, safe
description: The Johnville Guest House is a renovated home in the heart of the rural hills of Johnville New Brunswick.  Just 4 km from the beautiful St. John River Valley, the Guest House is a perfect location for a relaxing stay away from the city.  Main floor includes fully equipped kitchen, open concept dining/living room, main bedroom, full bath and laundry.  Second floor has a second bedroom (2 twin beds or 1 king), a spacious separate living area with pull out couch and a 1/2 bath. A lovely, safe haven
neighborhood_overview: We are directly across from the Johnville Labyrinth and Fairy Path and are close to trails for hiking or bicycling in summer and snow shoeing and cross country skiing in winter.  There are several downhill ski facilities within driving distance (Mars Hill Maine, Crabbe Mountain, Mount Farlagne not far off ) and golf clubs (Hartland, Mars Hills Maine, Aroostock Valley, Woodstock, Grand Falls).  Snow mobile trails are also easily accessible.  There are several art galleries (the Andrew & Laura McCain Gallery in Florenceville-Bristol is under 15 minutes away as well as Creek Village Gallery and Cafe in Woodstock and Acanthus Gallery in Grand Falls).  There is a local farmers' market every Thursday in the summer in Florenceville-Bristol.  There is also the River Bend Balloon Festival in Bath every long weekend in September for those who wish to try hot air ballooning or just take in the majesty of the balloons floating along the river valley.  NOTE:  leave from doorstep for large interconn
host_about: I am a retired speech-language pathologist who loves travel and exploring other cultures.  I love to cook, read, garden and hike. I sing in an adult community choir.  My husband and I are very involved in the local arts community; we run the Second Wind Music Centre which promotes music through lessons and concerts.

name: Authentic Cottage
description:
Our newly renovated cottages are nestled in the woods near the Kouchibouguac National Park.
Nestled among the woods at the edge of the park, Xpérience Kouchibouguac, boasts trails that connect directly from your accommodation to the famous hiking and cross country skiing trails of the National Park.

We offer accommodation year round

Family Getaways
Organized Local Group Tours
Snowmobile Trails
Snow Shoeing
Skiing & Walking Trails
neighborhood_overview:
A nature wonderland! Beaches and dunes nearby. Most notably - Kelly’s beach, a 8 km long stretch of gorgeous sand, with the warmest water north of Virginia, USA.
Centrally located between Miramichi and Moncton. Only a drive away to Richibucto (Wharf) , Rexton, (Bonar Law Museum), Bouctouche (Dune), Le Pays de la Sagouine, Shediac and the Confederation Bridge.
Our guests can enjoy convenient access to the Kouchibouguac National Park directly from our site, including terrain for hikers, and cyclists. There are also endless trails for ATVs. Cross-country skiing, fat biking, snowshoeing and snowmobiling are popular activities in winter!

name: Waterview 3 bedroom cottage in Bouctouche, NB
description:
This beautiful 3 bedroom cottage, has a great view of the water, and is equipped with everything you need to make your stay enjoyable!
Air conditioner and ceiling fans!
There is a propane BBQ and a table with chairs on the large deck.
Satellite TV/well-equipped kitchen. Bring your k-cups to enjoy your favorite coffee! Wi-fi
We are five minutes from the resort town of Bouctouche, NB and thirty-five minutes from Moncton.
We are on a private road making this a very peaceful location.
neighborhood_overview: Vivelo Cottages is situated on the south side of the Little Bouctouche River, and that makes this the best place to enjoy our gorgeous sunsets. We are one quarter mile down a private road. We are five minutes from the resort town of Bouctouche, NB, where you will lots of attractions like Pays de la Sagouine, the Irving Ecological Center (the dunes), the soap factory, new farmers market on Saturday's, beaches, etc.
host_about:
We have been in the hospitality business for the past 30 years. Your  comfort is our upmost concern. Our goal is to make this the best vacation place around. We love meeting new people and also to welcome our guests that return to our place every year.
We enjoy spending time with family and friends,  nice walks with our little dog and winter trips in Florida.

name: Rusty Lantern Cabins #4
description:
Quiet, peaceful location for a great outdoor getaway. Stay in one of our 4 season cabins, great location for 4 wheeling, hunting, fishing, bird watching, star gazing, canoeing, kayaking and snowmobiling. Kayak & Snowmobile rentals available.

We welcome your pet dogs on site but ask that they are aways leashed. We have chickens and their guardian (very friendly) Ziggy the border collie on the property. Due to allergies we can no longer accept cats.
neighborhood_overview:
We are 41 km east of Florenceville on Route 107 and approx 4 km east of the Juniper corner store.

We have a coffee shop on site open Mon-Sat 7 a.m. - 4 p.m. (hours may vary, depending on the season) There you will find Kelly baking fresh bread daily along with other goodies and a variety of to go options. Our local Juniper pub, The Village Pour House is open Thurs. - Sun. If you are interested in visiting the largest salmon fly sculpture in Canada visit the Juniper Community Centre, the tea room is open in the summer months Thurs-Sat with a second hand shop upstairs and a lending library.

If you are interested in kayaking with have rentals and shuttle our guest to the Miramichi headwaters. A great outing for couples and families.
host_about:
We have been married for over 30 years, most of that time on Lake Simcoe, Ontario where we enjoyed raising our 2 now grown children.  The love of snowmobiling, atving, the great outdoors and following a life long dream brought us to Juniper, N.B. in May of 2019 and Rusty Lantern Cabins was created. 

We love what we do and feel very blessed and privileged to meet so many amazing people.

name: Country Charm in Shannon, NB
description: This house was built in 1910 by the Jones Family in Shannon.  The house maintains a lot of its original charm, with wood wainscotting and cedar shingle finish.   It is located within walking distance of the farm and the Jones Mill Falls, which makes a great swimming hole in the Summer time.  At the farm, help with the chores such as feeding a calf.  You can also fish in our u-fish lake for speckled trout, hike the trails or paddle around the lake in a canoe.
neighborhood_overview: We are close to the Washademoak Lake for boaters in the summer time.  We are also centrally located between Saint John, Moncton and Fredericton, about an hours drive from each.

description:
Welcome to the peaceful, private and clean, Cape Enrage Fundy Log Cabin. This cozy, and historic home is nestled in the heart of forestry and is just a 5min walk to three beautiful tidal beaches that stretch for miles.
Many popular local attractions are close by including; Cape Enrage Lighthouse Adventures , Fundy Park Alma, and the world famous Hopewell Rocks.
Local activities include, ziplining, rock climbing, whiskey tour, kyacking, horseback, fishing, hiking, biking, waterfalls & swimming.

Many markets, gift shops and artisan studios are in the surrounding area.

name: Taffy Lake Retreat
description: This is a unique lakefront cottage, a quaint rustic retreat. A great spot for a nature enthusiast, stays include the use of kayaks, canoes, paddle boards, a pedal boat, etc. This is a quiet spot with only a half dozen camps on this end of the lake. Think relaxation, not rip roaring excitement. It is family/couple friendly, not for parties. Quiet lake in rural NB.
neighborhood_overview:
Taffy Lake is a secluded lake just outside the village of Millville. It is approximately 45-60 minutes from Fredericton, 30 minutes from Woodstock and 20 minutes from Nackawic.
The possibilities for adventures are endless, there is unlimited four wheeling and sights to see. Most trails are well traveled by four wheelers, trucks, but are also shared by people who like mountain biking and hiking.
Additionally, we have included the use of our kayaks, inflatable tubes, and canoe, use of fire pit area (please check for fire bans). Use of bbq.

Taffy Lake is a remote area. The nearest community is Millville, currently has no reliable gas station (it is currently for sale). Other than that, we are 25 minutes away from Nackawic which has the nearest grocery store, nearest gas station, liquor store and bank. Come prepared. That being said we are often in Woodstock, Fredericton or Nackawic so feel free to reach out if you need something.
In Nackawic there is pizza t
host_about:
Our family is local and has enjoyed our time on this lake for years. There are only about six cottages on our end of the lake, so it is quiet and tranquil.  It's a great place to come and reconnect with your family and with nature.  The cottage itself is a bit quirky in design, it’s had four separate owners after all.
Our cottage includes the use of kayaks, canoe, pedal boat, fire pit area including firewood, bbq, etc. at no additional charge.

name: Sunset Escape
description: Need an escape? Trailer with loads of room on private lot at Lake George, only 25 minutes from Fredericton! Queen bed, pullout double , drop table double, and 4 bunkbeds, one being a double. Walk 10 steps and you are swimming in the one of the freshest lakes in Canada! Large back lawn for tents or a game of washers-cozy front deck with chairs and bbq. Kayaks and canoe available for trips to the cove or fishing. Special weekly and monthly rates.  Check-in time is 3p.m; check-out is 11:00a.m..
neighborhood_overview: This is a place to relax and let your hair down.  During your time at Lake George you will have the opportunity to meet many of the friendly neighbors. Within minutes of our lake are many trails, Kings Landing Historical Settlement, waterfalls and the Acorn Restaurant.  As you travel 20 minutes in different directions you have the town of Nackawic, Capital City of Fredericton, and Mactaquac Park
host_about: I am a retired school administrator from New Brunswick and enjoy meeting new people. I have travelled to different parts of the world, but at the end of the day, New Brunswick, Canada is home!   I am very respectful of other peoples' places and hope that others will also be respectful of mine.

name: Stylish, modern home next to beach - Cap Pelé area
description:
Betty's by the Beach is a 3-minute walk from the beautiful Atlantic ocean. The beach is clean and you can swim (if you're staying in the summer!). This 4-season getaway home is located in a quiet, well-maintained area.

Why Betty's on the Beach? This home is named after my grandma, who was known for hosting people. She always had something warm and generous to say. I think you'll find that warm vibe here.

Plus all of the amenities you need: fully equipped kitchen, fibre op internet, cable
neighborhood_overview:
Betty's by the Beach is your ideal getaway location to unwind. We have fast wifi and cable if you want them, though there's also plenty of nature to enjoy. You can bike along the quiet streets, head to the beach or lounge at the house or in the screened-in gazebo.

If you need 'staples', we're a quick 10 minute drive away from:

- the Fresh Mart grocery store
- 2 bakeries
- fish markets, if you want to try local fish (!)
- the l'Aboiteau wharf and beach
- Tim Hortons
- NB liquor store inside the Irving
- multiple gas stations
host_about: I'm an east coast entrepreneur who loves both hosting and travelling.  I've travelled to five continents, and the thing I'm always looking for is a sense of community and wonder.

name: Harbour Lights
description: This beloved cottage perched right above St Martin's Harbour has been in the same family for four generations. You'll find unprecedented views of the harbour and  the open waters of the Bay of Fundy. Enjoy a quick walk to the bustling harbour  for coffee and craft shops or to the Village to the best General Store for almost all your needs. You have quick access to the 3 km sand and pebble beach which is perfect for running and walking.
neighborhood_overview: This cottage has a really warm family feel to it. You can walk everywhere, to the famous sea caves, to town or to the beach. The incredible Fundy Parkway is a short drive away for a perfect day's outing.  While you are there we would love it if you would take part in our family tradition by making a "Scallop Head" , using treasures collected from the beach. We look forward to your creation!

description: Live in a 19th century home. This period house is authentic and you feel like you're in another time. You have a laundry room and access to the entire grounds with access leading directly to the sea.
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Acadie. The beautiful Peninsula-Acadienne welcomes you with open arms. We are located in Caraquet, on the shoreline of Baie des Chaleurs. name: Cottage in The Bluff
description:
Welcome to our cottage! This well loved cottage has been in our family for decades, and we have given it new life by fully renovating it.

Enjoy the beach by day, and spacious living space by evening, and the comfortable beds by night. The large deck has a BBQ and fire pit table, the prefect place to unwind after a long day exploring.

We are a short 5 minute walk to Parlee Beach, and located in the popular Bluff Area.

We hope you will enjoy and respect our cottage just as much as we do!
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is located in the cottage community known as The Bluff.  With mature trees and unpaved roads, you will enjoy a relaxing walk to the beach.  We are walking distance (30 minute walk) to the popular Pointe-du-Chene wharf, where you can enjoy some local flavours and enjoy the sunset over the water.
host_about: Hi there!  My name is Jasmine and this cottage had been owned by my grandparents my entire life(and well before I was born), so the love I hold for this property is enormous!  My dream has always been to keep the cottage in the family, and some dreams come true.  Since I work full time, and can't get full use out of our place, I have decided to open the cottage to others in hopes that families can create amazing memories as well.

name: Welcome to The Stumble Inn! A quiet retreat!
description:
Our cosy cottage is located on eleven acres of beautiful private wooded ground. We want your stay to be enjoyable and have provided all the comforts of home. All you need are your groceries and personal items.

Please note that this property is located in a rural area and is a thirty min drive to Fredericton and/or Nackawic.





We welcome your well behaved , house trained dogs as well.

**Tick season is year round so please be mindful of that and check yourselves and your pups**
neighborhood_overview:
If you love to snowmobile or drive an ATV then our place is the perfect home base to use. Our large driveway makes it easy for you to park your trailers and unload your snowmobile or wheelers. There are trails nearby and you can drive right from our cottage.

Our place is also a perfect spot for family gatherings or for someone looking for a peaceful , quiet space surrounded by nature. It’s also an intimate getaway for couples looking for some alone time away from it all.


Located just an 18 minute drive to the Village of Harvey, N.B. where you will find a gas station/Pizza Twice, Smith’s Country Store for grocery needs as well as Black’s convenience which is also has a liquor outlet and a cafe . They sell Off Grid Ale craft beer , Think Brewing craft beer as well as Big Fiddle Still, a vodka infused drink all which are produced locally in Harvey, N.B.

A fifteen minute drive to Mads Truck Stop/Acorn Restaurant as well as Kings Landing Historic
host_about: My husband and I own our own business and we enjoy our time travelling and spending time with our family and friends. We enjoy the outdoors whether it’s snowmobiling, wheeling or having friends over to bbq .

description: Welcome to the Après Adventure! Our beautiful open concept chalet is located just steps away from the base of Poley Mountain ski resort. After a day in the great outdoors, relax in the cozy atmosphere of the chalet or take a soak in the hot tub surrounded by nature. Hop in the car and enjoy the stunning fundy coast with Fundy National park (Alma) 30 minutes away and the Fundy Trail (St. Martin’s) just 25 minutes away. neighborhood_overview:
Waterford is located just outside of Sussex. Nearby restaurants include the Slope Side bar at Poley Mountain and Adair’s Wilderness lodge. A short drive will bring you into the town of Sussex which also offers a variety of restaurants, two of our favourites are Taste and See and Knocks Cafe.

Our Chalet a 25 minute drive to the East Gate entrance of the Fundy Trail Parkway in St. Martin’s and a 50 minute drive to Fundy National Park in Alma.

name: Whispering Pines Lodge| 8 guests
description:
Where the road ends and your journey begins.
This beautiful spot is located nestled on the banks of the Miramichi river about 1km off Route 8 . Perfect location for winter, spring, summer and fall activities. You will feel right at home in this private locate. A great spot to reconnect, de-stress and recharge .
You will enjoy all the comforts of home in this beautiful country feel lodge style home.
Ideal spot for a lot of winter activities; snowmobile trail just across the road, so much more.
neighborhood_overview:
This space is an ideal spot to get away and recharge or a perfect location to do outdoor activities all year round.
It is close to some essentials to make your stay convenient ; gas station, general store with NB liquor agency, licensed restaurant and bakery, woodsman museum and a country craft and decor store. These are all located within a 2 km radius from the lodge.
Also , if you don’t mind a short scenic drive, you can head to Doaktown ( approx 25km NW) for a Tim Hortons coffee and check out Bett’s family restaurant.
Conveniently the NB snowmobile trail runs right by the house , so you can easily snowmobile to our location for your stay.
Bring your snowshoes or cross country skis and see the property from a different perspective.
If you are lucky you may see some of the locate deer.

name: Cast Away Lodge Riverfront Luxury w/HOT TUB
description:
The sun will greet you on the deck as you wake up from a silent slumber where you will be surrounded by nature. Will you go for a lazy tubing trip on the Miramichi River today? Will you try your luck fishing the great Atlantic salmon or striped bass? Perhaps sightseeing in nearby Miramichi? Whatever your choice you made a great one in choosing Cast Away Lodge...Cast your worries away! Like us on FB @gocastawaylodge
*video surveillance on ring doorbell & porch pointing at the driveway.
neighborhood_overview:
Cast Away is secluded but you are only minutes away from the Village of Blackville where you will find a grocery store, liquor store, hardware store, post office, and pharmacy in addition to a number of restaurants.

The City of Miramichi is a short 30 minute drive.

Blackville Municipal Park features enchanting walking trails, a playground, picnic area, boat launch, splash pad, pavilion and an observation deck.

Outdoor enthusiasts will be happy to know Cast Away is just minutes away from a dedicated ATV and Snowmobile trail. You can even walk-it, bike-it, or hike-it.

You will have access to fishing guides and a private salmon pool (additional fees apply) if you would like to try your hand at fly fishing.

Canoe rentals, kayak rentals and tube rentals nearby.

Adventure awaits!
host_about:
Hi….I’m Beth.  I’m a “military brat” who lived and travelled all over the world growing up.  Many of my summers were spent on the Mighty Miramichi, where my mom and generations before her were born.  I loved spending time with my Grandparents here, and have many fond memories of these New Brunswick summers. 
My Uncle and Aunt recently moved back to the Miramichi and ventured into the vacation rental business.  They opened up Cast Away Vacation rentals in May of 2020 and have thoroughly enjoyed helping guests create special and memorable vacations on the beautiful Miramichi River.
My husband Mike and I (with our three children) have decided to jump on board with the intent to carry on creating these exciting experiences for guests at the Lodge and at our newest property the Grand Lodge. 
We are pleased and proud to be assuming the reins of Cast Away Vacation Rentals in September of 2022.  We look forward to hosting you, your family and friends very soon!!!
~Beth and Mike

description:
This home is located in a safe and quiet family neighborhood. When enjoying the large fenced in backyard, BBQ and deck you may be visited by birds, squirrels and deer. A great place to relax while listening to the spring-fed brook nearby.

Within a 5 minute walk you can get to the Kennebecasis River and a small public park.

Within a 5 minute drive you can go swimming at Tucker Park Beach.

name: Waters Edge Bay of Fundy St. Martins/West Quaco
description:
Stunning 4 bedroom , 1 bathroom private home on sprawling 3 acre property with your own Bay of Fundy cliff side lookout.
Just steps from incredible secluded Browns Beach , 2kms to picturesque West Quaco Lighthouse and only 4 to 5 kms to restaurants , shops , the harbor and the famous St. Martins Sea Caves.
The House is newly furnished and decorated with modern decor and local artwork. Large kitchen and oversized deck makes this the perfect place for larger groups or families.
neighborhood_overview:
This property has the added bonus of being steps away from one of the areas best kept secrets... Browns Beach.
Very few tourists will see this beach , it is a great place away from the crowds.
host_about:
Hello , I am Pat and I love St. Martins and the Bay of Fundy. 
I manage several incredible vacation homes here  in St. Martins and West Quaco.
I manage...
Authentic Bay of Fundy Beachside Home ,Waters Edge Bay of Fundy, Rosehill Cottage by the Sea Caves and Homestead -Gateway to the Fundy Trail.
I also opperate a custom Woodworking store - Authentic Bay of Fundy store/studio specializing in one of a kind charcuterie boards and Laser engraving located at 15 Beach Street.
We are excited to share the incredible village of St. Martins with our guests and hope to provide the ideal vacation experience.

We understand the variety of vacation styles that may appeal to different groups and hope to provide the best experience to suit each groups needs.

We plan to offer our guests all the privacy wanted when renting a vacation home or cottage but we also want to be available for any information , recommendations or to help arrange the perfect excursions or personalised souvenirs/gifts.. so feel free to reach out to me.
We look forward to having you as our guests here in beautiful St. Martins New Brunswick.

name: Home with a spectacular view!
description:
Our old family homestead is waiting for you! From the wrap-around veranda, enjoy a "Million Dollar View" of the majestic expanse of the Shepody Marshes, Mary's Point Bird Sanctuary and Grindstone Island. Nicely located in rural NB, just 10 km from the Hopewell Rocks, 24 km from Cape Enrage, 13 km from Shepody National Wildlife area (Mary's Point), and 32 km to Fundy National Park.
Saw Mill Creek Covered Bridge and walking trails are just a minute away.
neighborhood_overview:
Bring your kayaks and bikes to this destination because both opportunities are a hop, skip, and jump away!
A family style restaurant (including seafood! and gluten free meals) is a short 5 minute drive away.
Liquor store, pharmacy, gas station with take out meals are within a 5 minute drive.
This property is located within 10 minutes of the world famous Hopewell Rocks where you can explore the ocean floor by foot at low tide and by kayak at high tide.
Fundy National Parks offers dozens of hiking trails, beaches and a beautiful golf course.
The village of Alma, outside Fundy National Park, has shops, restaurants, a micro brewery and fresh lobster direct from the fisherman (seasonally).
Cape Enrage with its beautiful lighthouse and fog horn dating back to 1838 offers adventures including rapelling, zip-lining, obstacle course and a beach walk at low tide.
host_about: We are sisters who proudly have a 6th generation connection to this part of Albert County, New Brunswick.  We love this area and are so proud of it.  We welcome you to enjoy it as much as we do (Website hidden by Airbnb)

description: Tucked away at the end of a private lane, this country charmer is surrounded by forest on 3 sides, with hot tub, fire-pit, wood-fired pizza oven & priv.walking trail. Great home base for day trips, snowmobile trail  is seconds away,  then come back and relax in the hot tub.  Pet friendly. To note, this is a rural location.
neighborhood_overview: Convenience store and gas bar just seconds away with ATM. There are also two liquor stores minutes away and Robin's Coffee. Lots of little areas to go for walks and ATV trails nearby. Snowmobile trails from the backyard in winter.  Mactaquac Prov. Park is 5 min. away,  offering golfing, swimming, and hiking trails. Skiing at Crabbe Mountain,30 min. away. Food trucks are usually in the area on weekends now too in the summer months.
host_about: My husband and I have lived in the area all our lives,and have two dogs and two cats. I've been a stylist for 39 years,and salon owner for the last 15. We love finding small towns with interesting little shops to look through,and take day trips for hiking with friends and the dogs. We also have two antique muscle cars that we take to car shows and the occasional race.  This is the second home we have renovated,and I can't wait for you to see it!

name: Parlee Beach Cottage. 3 Min Walk to Beach
description:
A cute cottage on a quiet side street close to the Pointe du Chene Wharf and Parlee Beach (Within 200 Meters to Parlee Beach) Near walking and biking trails, Parlee Beach Park, Big Lobster and Downtown Shediac

The cottage has 2 bedroom (Queen and 2 singles). You will find a sofa bed in the living room to accommodate more guests. Enjoy the A/C in the warm summer/fall days. Outside there is a very large patio furnished to dine in at night and enjoy the sunset right from the Beach.
neighborhood_overview:
200 Meters - Parlee Beach
2 Kilometres - Pointe Du Chene Wharf
4 Kilometres - Main Street Shediac (Restaurants, Grocery Store & Big Lobster)
25 Kilometres - Moncton
25 Kilometres - Pays de la Sagouine
111 Kilometres - Fundy National Park
host_about:
Hi, I am a 26 year old young professional from Moncton, NB and have been a happy home owner for the past three years! I love the outdoors, but also the convenience of city living and look forward to meeting new friends through Airbnb. 5 Things I can't live without is Sports, Cooking, Hiking , Camping and Reading. I am a very social guy who likes to make everyone feel comfortable. If you have any questions feel free to email me.

Thanks 
Antonio

name: Cottage on Washdemoak Lake, Cambridge-Narrows
description:
Welcome to Maple Grove, the Best Kept Secret in NB! Centrally located in the heart of Cambridge-Narrows with a 1 min stroll to Washdamoak Lake; an hours drive from Saint John, Fredericton, Moncton & Sussex.

Bring the whole family, even the dog! Ideal location for relaxed gatherings, girls/friends nights & restorative getaways.
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of cottage country, located in Lower Cambridge with easy access to the Washademoak Lake. See points of interest below 👇🏼

FUN THINGS TO DO IN AREA:

• Friday farmers Market at Nove’s Place 3:00pm-7:00pm (across the street from Nans Convenience Store)

• close to “The Cuts” (swimming hole with goldfish) located at 129 East Scotch Settlement Rd or enter “The Cuts” into google maps

• blueberry ‘u-pick’ across from #3350 on Route 715, Lower Cambridge Rd. Also in West Scotch Settlement (485-2427)

• Motts Landing Winery, 3506 Lower Cambridge Rd

• Midland Medows Golf Course

• Turners One Stop Diner and Grill (Ma + Pa joint)

• Henderson Falls; hike in and take in the waterfall

• Elkes BBQ; stock up for your next grill session! 1337 Route 715, Lower Cambridge

• Raymond Young’s vegetable and fruit stand in Jemseg; ask about their strawberry’u-pick’

• visit the his
host_about: I am an avid collector of vintage and antiques, with a major obsession for Persian rugs. You can always find me at estate sales, flea markets or a good ole fashioned yard sale. I am an avid yogi and believe in mindfulness. I spent over a decade working in the hospitality industry and absolutely love meeting new people and cultivating those relationships. I am a pet momma to a senior special needs Ragdoll named Misha and Rottweiler named Emma.

Beautifully decorated and offering an enclosed patio. outdoor seating and A/C. Large parking area, and backyard privacy.

Seaside patio equipped with BBQ,  patio table and rocking chair.  Wifi/smart TV.  Cycle path and touristic attractions and all commodities for grocery/ pharmacy nearby.  Enjoy Acadian way

name: Cottage style house w/ ocean access, 2 full baths.
description:
2 minute walk to the water. Enjoy the warmth of the wood stove in a cozy little haven near the Shediac Bay.

Open concept kitchen and living room with plenty of seating.

Screened in porch, fire pit access, large backyard for kids and pets.

Washer and dryer on site. Great internet connection with 2 TV media streaming devices (Netflix, Prime).

Gas station (Tony’s Esso), convenience store (Evangeline) fish market (Joe Caissie) and grocery store (Cocagne variété) all within 5 minutes of driving.
neighborhood_overview:
Very quiet side road with water access.

Quick access (2 minute walk) to the ocean/bay which means the water is usually calm for kayaking or paddle boarding (available for guest access on site).

10 minute walk to Rendez-Vous restaurant (Korean take out + deep fried clams/food + ice cream)

15 minute walk to Chez Leo restaurant (deep fried clams/food)

15 minute walk to Esso gas station/convenience or 20 minute walk to Evangeline convenience store.

12 minute drive to Shediac.

20 minute drive to Parlée Beach (can also access by kayak paddle board across the water if you’re feeling adventurous).

25 minute drive to downtown Moncton.
host_about: I'm an French Atlantic Canadian who enjoys travelling, hiking, paddleboarding and kayaking.  NB native who's lived in the Moncton/Grande Digue area for over 12 years. Active foodie and frequent traveler who's happy to provide day excursion and restaurant recommendations within NB and the Maritime.

name: The Crew's Nest Cottage at Parlee Beach
description:
This cottage is all about location, comfort and open space. And in true Maritime charm, it takes on a feeling of home for anyone who stays here. Enjoy time with your loved ones, including your furry ones, at The Crew’s Nest Cottage.

After a day at the beach, walk back home within minutes and spend the evening BBQing and lounging on the back deck. Whether you’re coming as a couple or as a family, The Crew’s Nest Cottage will be sure to suit your needs perfectly.
neighborhood_overview:
Your family will enjoy a 5 minute walk to the warmest salt waters North of the Carolina’s, and a 10 minute walk to the charming Pointe-Du-Chêne wharf. Here you’ll find ice-cream shops, restaurants, bars, art galleries and gift shops. You’ll also find the fun Ecocentre Homarus Eco-Centre, the lighthouse, and cruise tours.

Only a few minutes drive away is the quaint town of Shediac for groceries, gas stations, restaurants, hardware stores and so much more.

description:
Indulge in the stay of a lifetime on your very own private island! Enjoy 9 acres of rugged nature and modern luxuries.

The Lakehouse: 6 bedrooms, 4,500+ sq. ft., for up to 12 guests. Breathtaking water views from every window, high-speed WiFi, 3-length boat dock, large front and back decks, private beaches, 5 TVs, fire pit, upgraded kitchen, bar, games room, whirlpool and soaker tubs, and two hot tubs facing sunrise and sunset.

Maquapit Lake: Renowned for its serene beauty, perfect for swimming, boating, and fishing.

Nearby Nature Reserves: Explore lush forests and scenic trails ideal for hiking, birdwatching, and wildlife spotting.

Historical Sites: Discover the rich history of New Brunswick with visits to local landmarks and museums.

Cultural Experiences: Enjoy local festivals, farmers' markets, and artisan shops showcasing the best of New Brunswick's culture and crafts.

Outdoor Adventures: Engage in thrilling activities like jet skiing, ice skating, cross-country skiing, and snowmobiling in the surrounding areas.

Away from it all! ...But nothing is out of reach:
Just 25 minutes from an international airport, 30 minutes from the nearest urban city center, and only 8 minutes to a convenience store, liquor store, and seasonal take-out restaurants.

name: Manoir Highfield
description:
A home away from home !
Welcome to this beautiful red brick house built in 1904. This century home was meticulously renovated with modern amenities to enjoy. Located within walking distance to downtown Moncton. name: 2 By the Sea - Dock Look Out
description:
Winter beauty, you can snowshoe across to the island once it freezes over or go ice fishing! Beautiful sunrises, lots of trails nearby for cross country skiing or ATVing if that's your thing. The woodpile is stocked for winter bonfires.
Great locations for day trips to the Bay of Fundy, just 30 minutes to Moncton.
I live in the loft upstairs, you have a fully private apartment.
Just bring your food and personal items and enjoy the Acadian Coastline.
neighborhood_overview: Florina Beach  is a popular spot for floaties (shallow water), fishing and boating.  The  shallow water is great for families when the tide  is out and fishing when the tide is in. Learn to Kayak in the safer waters (we are sheltered a bit by Cocagne Island across the bay.  You may see  oyster beds, muscles, lobster traps and fishing boats. You definitely will see  a wide variety of bird life.  Bring your binoculars!
host_about: My name is Carol Ledden-Cusson and I recently sold my home in Toronto and have moved EAST to the coast, where I am excited to create 3 new waterfront rental properties. I will live in the upper loft of one, and rent out the dock level, and the cottage next door.  I became a widow in Jan 2020 and we had planned on coming out here because of its beauty, so I am doing it for the both of us now.

name: Chalet - 2 étages Peut accueillir jusqu'a 8 pers.
description:
- RENT -
Chalet the HERON at Val Comeau NB ACADIAN PENINSULA
The Chalet le Heron is very well located, between the Tracadie River and the Grande Mer!
On foot and in a matter of minutes, you have access to a vast beach where you can bathe, relax on the sand or even fish for striped bass. For early risers, you can admire exceptional sunrises!
neighborhood_overview:
On the Tracadie River side, you can also enjoy a body of water and go kayaking… and watch the legendary sunsets of the Acadian Peninsula.
Friendly by nature, the Acadian Peninsula is full of beauties that are all accessible shortly. Whether you want to visit Miscou, its historic lighthouse and enjoy a meal at the Terrace in Steve with the two feet literally in the sand, visit the Aquarium and Shippagan Marin Center or the Acadian Historical Village of Caraquet, have a great coffee in a great cafe, or a beer in a microbrewery you will be served as desired!

For bike lovers!
The Route de la Peninsula Acadienne alone will charm you and will make you want to come back years after years. There are nearly 300 km of roadside trails including 80 km of closed asphalt circuit trails ( no motor traffic) which are of very high quality and very safe. They will bring you from Shippagan to Caraquet to Tracadie without even having to leave it. You may even have access to high q

Individual four-season air-conditioned chalet located close to Lake Baker and a restaurant with terrace on the lake with private entrance!

Discover the charm of our cozy lakeside chalets. On site, a warm restaurant with panoramic views of the mountains, decorated with a large terrace by the lake. Dairy bar that offers several varied products during the summer season.
Several activities are available to you during your stay. In summer you will find several water activities such as kayaks, pedalos, paddle boards and more. There is also hiking and mountain biking. Gas station on site year-round, all together for a magnificent family vacation by Lake Baker.

name: Big and spacious Cabin overlooking the river
description: This cedar nature lodge overlooking the picturesque views of the Little Southwest Miramichi River. Step inside this spacious haven, once a meeting room transformed into a spacious cabin retreat. With two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you'll have all the space you need for a memorable stay. A private hot tub is waiting for you. Soak up the tranquility, unwind in nature's embrace, and let the stresses of everyday life melt away.
neighborhood_overview: Surrounding the Lo'gsi'gan-The Cabin, you'll find the Miramichi River which is famous for fishing, swimming and tubing. Explore the area on foot through light, moderate and heavily trafficked walking trails. On the grounds you will find Metepenagiag Heritage Park, a modern interpretive center highlighting the 3000 year history of Metepenagiag's Mi'kmaq Culture.  Our trails lead to the river where you can go swimming, snorkeling or fishing.
host_about: Embracing the beauty of nature, heritage, and community. I am the General Manager of a lodge and cultural center nestled in breathtaking surroundings. Proudly showcasing indigenous history and creating unforgettable experiences. Grateful for the privilege to share my culture and celebrate the wonders of our land. Join myself and my amazing staff on this incredible journey!

name: LongJohns Lodge-right on the trail!
description:
LongJohns Lodge -in the snowmobile capital of Atlantic Canada!
Only 3 mins from Nepisiguit Sports Lodge and direct access to miles of the best trails! Whether it be for snowmobiling, ATVing, hunting or fishing in the Nepisiguit River or just a nice hike, there is something for everyone. Relax by the fireplace with your family. Perfect for work or for an any season getaway. This spacious lodge has plenty of room to enjoy. 27 mins to Bathurst to visit beaches, golfing, dining, shopping...
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to LongJohns Lodge!
Nepisiguit Falls area is beautiful every season throughout the year! The Nepisiguit river flows right to the top of the falls where one of the oldest dams in New Brunswick produces electricity.
Great for all outdoor enthusiasts !
You can leave by ATV or sled right from the back door to access miles of the best trails!

In the summer the river offers crystal clear water which is great for swimming, fishing & boating of all kinds .
The spring & fall seasons are breathtaking!
The spring brings the thaw of the river- the waterfall is thunderous, powerful and amazing! A quick run in your ATV will get you to beautiful Papineau Falls as well.
The Fall season is breathtaking with its amazing colours of the fall foliage! Avid hunters love it here!
Wintertime is when the place really wakes up to fun in the snow! Located only 3 mins from Nepisiguit Sports Lodge, Snowmobile Club #1.
Not a sled head? No problem! Yo
host_about:
Hi there!
My name is Liana, my husband Doug and I are avid snowmobilers , ATVer’s , boaters...well just about anything outside, we love!
We love to meet new friends and truly hope your visit is nothing short of magical! 
Please don’t hesitate to contact us with anything you may need. We will do our best to accommodate!

name: The Shorebird - ocean views & beach - St Andrews
description: Enjoy panoramic ocean views from a contemporary waterfront home. Wake up with the sunrise over Passamaquoddy Bay (Bay of Fundy). Spend the day beach combing or just sitting on the deck and watching the tide. At night, get cozy with Netflix in our upstairs entertainment area or have an outdoor fire & star gaze. Drive 10 min to St. Andrews/35 min to New River Beach. Perfect for multiple couples, families, working remote, holiday gatherings or girls getaway (+ divers’ and bird watchers’ delight!).
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighbourhood is quiet, with mostly permanent residents on large lots around Passamaquoddy Bay. There is a public road that goes down to the beach next to the property.

St. Andrews-by-the-Sea is Canada's gem - a go-to for whale watching & other sea life, golfing, a farmer's market, museums, art, restaurants. An incredible amount of history and charm year round. We would love to make sure you have all the info you need to have the vacation experience that is right for you.
host_about:
I spend my time chasing around my two little girls with my husband, Justin. I grew up in Northern Ontario, surrounded by a New Brunswick marketing campaign carefully overseen by my Fredericton parents. Posters, art, music - even little figurines of Saint Andrews, where Justin and I are hosts. 

We spent every family vacation on the east coast & now I get to do the same with my daughters. In between, we hope you enjoy our home.

name: Belliveau Beach Corner Cottage
description:
It's all about location! This cozy cottage offers everything you need for a perfect getaway minutes from the pet-friendly portion of Parlee Beach!

Full kitchen, bathroom and patio for BBQ!

The land is shared with our smaller "bunk house" (Bunkie!) cottage (with one Queen bed), which you can reserve along with this unit (if available) to have plenty of space for the whole family.

*NEW* Reservation now includes a complimentary coffee-tasting experience for two at Epoch Chemistry in Moncton!
