name: Sandy Bottoms Beach House
description:
Located in the heart of L’Acadie, Aboiteau Beach is a must see for vacationers! An eco‑responsible treasure, known for its accessibility, cleanliness and safety, Aboiteau Beach has been awarded the Blue Flag certification since 2018.

Sandy Bottoms is picturesque place just a few short steps to the beach where your family will fall in love with golden sand, salty waves and majestic dunes, you will enjoy the warmest waters in the North!

Come, Stay, Play and Discover!

name: Charming cottage in Parlee Beach
description:
Within a 5 minute walk to Parlee Beach!

This cottage sleeps 6 people.
- Bedroom 1: queen size bed, dresser, closet.
- Bedroom 2: queen, single bed, dresser, closet.
- Comfortable futon couch (double bed) in the living room
- Fully equipped kitchen
- Keurig coffee maker
- BBQ
- Washer/dryer + clothesline.
- Wifi
- Bathroom linens
- Bonfire pit

Nearby: Parlee Beach, walking & biking trails, restaurants, wharf, golf courses, movie drive-in and the World’s Largest Lobster sculpture.

description:
It's all about location! Our spacious cottage offers everything you need for a family getaway minutes from the dog-friendly portion of Parlee Beach!

A typical "Maritime Grandma" heirloom home (with modern bedding), the rickety interior serves the basics, but no more! None of the floors are level, nor do they match. It's a cozy space to lay your head after a day of fun in the sun.

name: Location!Cabin Retreat with River View
description:
Location Location! Welcome to 28 Colford lane, a charming and cozy log cabin situated on the banks of the Southwest Miramichi River and Provincial Trail 42. There are endless ways to relax, unwind and experience New Brunswick’s Great Outdoors – great fishing , canoe/kayaking , tubing and easy access to some of the best ATV and snowmobile trails just across the street from our Colford lane entrance.
Our Cabin comes equipped with all the comforts of home.
neighborhood_overview:
Just 10 kms from amenities on Main st. in Blackville,NB
Try Trio's for the best pizza or the delicious home cooking and huge portions at Burke's Diner or Hooked and Cooked
Close to multiple salmon fishing pools ( Miramichisalmon.ca )
2 kms from Vikers tubing

Provincial Trail 42 just across from the entrance to Colford lane.

name: Rustic Riverside Retreat~ The Magaguadavic Lodge
description: Nestled deep on 100 acres of private ground, our rustic riverside retreat is all you need for your getaway! Sitting riverside, our 100% off the grid timber lodge will allow you to relax, refresh and rejevenate! All you need is your clothes and a quick stop at the grocery store and you're all set! Everything you need is provided, a  fully equipped kitchen, cozy living room, a 3 pc. bathroom, and 2 bedrooms. The river and the sound of nothing but nature is all you really will need anyway!!
neighborhood_overview: Remote lodge tucked beside a beautiful river. 15 minutes outside of the village of Harvey Station, where you will find everything from shopping, grocery, restaurants and more!
host_about:
Hello!
My husband, myself & our 3 sons are undertaking a dream come true! 
We've worked incredibly hard to build this cabin (ourselves) for others to enjoy - and maybe ourselves once in awhile!

We want to share our way of living with as many as we can! We live simply and are self sufficient- raising our own beef and chickens, we have hens for eggs and large gardens, preserving it all. We are very outdoors related and our every day life is not like most!  

I enjoy being a stay at home mom, love taking photos, and hunting for a great antique bargain! 

My husband and sons love hunting, wheeling, and the outdoors of any kind!

As a family we enjoy hiking to local waterfalls, making maple syrup at the family sugar shack, fishing, and hunting for wild mushrooms.

name: Luxury Cottage on the Belleisle Bay w/ Hot Tub
description: A short hop, skip and ferry ride away with breathtaking views of Belleisle Bay, escape to The Fox Den to play, relax, and unwind. Nestled on over 5 acres, our luxurious cottage perfectly blends wooded privacy and pristine waterfront. Relax in the hammock, swim and lounge on the beach, take hike up the property for breathtaking views, and end the days stargazing in the hot tub – the choice is all yours!
neighborhood_overview: Approximately 15 km drive in either direction takes you to two towns, Hampton and Quispamsis, both have restaurants, grocery stores, gas etc. 40 km drive takes you to the city of Saint John, which has even more. 40 km to scenic St. Martin's and the beginning of the Beautiful Fundy Trail.

name: Great family cottage at Maquapit Lake
description:
Put your feet up and relax on the spacious deck or head down the lawn to your private beach for a swim. Enjoy your meals outdoors or in the dining area and then prepare for a lovely evening by the fire pit.

There is lots of open space to enjoy your stay.....The cottage sleeps 7 guests in two bedrooms and the sun porch. There is a lovely woodstove for a chilly night, 50 inch tv, Wi-Fi, Air Conditioning and all amenities needed.

Sit back, relax and enjoy your stay.......it's cottage time.
neighborhood_overview: You are only 35 minutes from the lovely city of Fredericton and 20 minutes from the town of Oromocto.  Ten minute drive down the road and there is a General Store, gas station and NBLC outlet.  A lovely market and greenhouse is down Scothtown Rd as well as Bertie's restaurant which features excellent stoneground  pizza.  At the Four corners down the Coy road is the 4 Corners restaurant , general store and gas station....great place for breakfast.
host_about: Hello, I 'm sure  you will love this peaceful cottage with a private beach and a beautiful deck for your morning coffee and evening happy hour.  I have spent many years at Maquapit Lake and have enjoyed them all. The nature,sunrises and privacy makes cottage life wonderful. I will be a phone call , or text away  if you should have any questions or need any assistance.

name: Coastal Waterfront Cottage, by St. Andrews Private
description:
Welcome to our cottage. 15 mins from resort town St Andrews by the Sea, 10 mins to NB's Chocolate town St Stephen.
Private oceanfront property,1.2 A, 400' of shoreline. Enjoy beautiful sunrises & sunsets, starry nights
Unplug, relax, curl up on the couch and read some of those books you never have time for., in the nostalgic feeling décor, Enjoy the natural environment , beach walks, Ocean Floor walks.
Amazing tides, completely empties the bay every 12hrs and then 6 hours later is full again
neighborhood_overview:
Whale watching tour, aquarium, wooden playground, shopping, fine dining, ghost walks, sea kayaking and so much more in the resort town of St. Andrews. https://www.townofsaintandrews.ca/visitors/
Chocolate museum, Cafe, splash pad, dining & shopping in St.Stephen.
outdoor concerts in both towns.
Waterfalls, hiking trails with beautiful views all this within 20 min ride..free ferry ⛴ to Deer isle 30 min, catch fee ferry to Campobello. World-famous Algonquin golf course and 3 more within 10 to 30 min away.
Atv Trails in close proximity. Soon to be dirt bike track as well.
Something for all ages, desires, and tastes.

description: The Starfish Cottage  private oceanfront retreat on Lighthouse road 1 mile from the Head Harbour Lighthouse where at low tide you can walk on the ocean floor to visit the island the lighthouse is on.  The Starfish renovated and has a lovely master bedroom with qu bed, 2nd br with qu bed, 3rd  with bunks and loft with twin. neighborhood_overview: Campobello Island is a special and idyllic island of New Brunswick, Canada but connected by bridge to Lubec, Maine 04652   You can drive through Maine to enter the island bridge.  If you are coming from Canada you can drive through the US   or take a government ferry to Deer Island at LeTete, New Brunswick to Deer Island and take the Campobello ferry to the island using East Coast Ferries.  A pleasant ride on the water!    Campobello Island is known for its beautiful views, sunsets and beaches for Sea Glass and treasure hunting as well as its many hiking trails.   Campobello was also the seasonal home for Franklin Delano Roosevelt where the worlds only International Park is located.   The Roosevelt Park covers nearly 1/3rd of the island and is jointly administered by the US and Canadian governments.    The Herring Cove Park has a very large sandy beach,  9 hole golf course overlooking the ocean and a restaurant.    The Starfish cottage is about 10 minutes once you cross the bridge if d

name: Cocagne Retreat! Oceanfront HotTub, Pool, Jacuzzi!
description: Enjoy a soak in the HOT TUB at this STUNNING WATERFRONT home! The POOL, yard, deck and fire-pit are all waterfront too! You will be charmed by the privacy and gorgeous nature that surrounds you. Cocagne Retreat is a great place for families, couples or friends! Book for summer and enjoy a dip in the pool, a stroll on the beach, BBQ and dining on the spacious deck, or for winter with HotTub, an indoor jetted tub, equipped kitchen and open concept dining and living room. Relax, unwind, retreat!
neighborhood_overview:
Cocagne is a quaint seaside village still reminiscent of family getaways, good seafood and strikingly beautiful nature. Step back in time and experience the Acadian coast the way it’s been enjoyed for decades.

Just a short drive to Bouctouche where you'll find the "Irving Nature Park Sand Dune" which is a protected boardwalk beach area, and the "Pays de la Sanguine" a fun historical village. Kouchibouguac National Park is beyond Bouctouche where you can rent fat tire bikes to ride through the trees or a kayak or canoe to experience the lakes and beaches!

In the other direction, Cocagne is just down the road with its charming seaside vibes. Shediac is a short drive away for lots of fresh caught eats and NB's most popular public beach - Parlee! Further along is Moncton with all the amenities one could ask for such as a waterpark, zoo, casino, shopping and spas! Keep going and you'll end up at Fundy National Park and Hopewell Rocks for the highest tides in the worl
host_about:
As a host who loves to travel, I strive to create memorable experiences for my guests who visit our little slice of paradise. I make myself available to recommend local experiences and to enhance your stay however possible. I can also leave you your space and allow you to soak up the good times!

My work takes me across the world and I therefore have great contacts all over. With my extensive online experiences, I've decided to start renting out my properties and those of other people that are looking to make their property become an income generator.

If i'm staying at your place, rest assured that I will treat like my own and leave it cleaner than when I arrived. I usually do the turnover as that is what I would wish for. ;)

As a host or property manager, I make sure your stay is comfortable, enjoyable and memorable. 

I look forward to hosting you and making you feel at home. 

I speak English, French and Spanish and I am available for any questions at all times.
Have a great stay!

name: The Lake House on Square Lake
description: Take it easy at this unique and tranquil getaway. Extraordinary panoramic waterfront views of Square Lake abound from this beautiful home set on a 2 acre lot.  Located 8km from renowned Sandy Beach in Cap Pele, you have the best of both worlds available to you.  Enjoy a unique setting on a very private property still close to  Cap Pele and 30 minutes from Moncton. Enjoy swimming or kayaking on a freshwater lake or take in the sunset from the long veranda or by the fire pit.  Pet friendly.
neighborhood_overview:
Private property at the end of a road servicing 10 cottages on a beautiful lake in Westmoreland county. Super peaceful and isolated yet, only 10 minutes from Cap Pele and its world renowned sandy beaches. You might enjoy the sight of a water skier on a quiet lake or just take the sunset from the kayak on any given day.
PLEASE NOTE: YOU ARE ON A LAKE. There will be flies, mosquitoes, likely geese, ducks, sometimes deers, there is a resident rabbit that roams around. It is 2.5km in the forest, but a wonderful place full of rich natural sounds....just off the highway 15.
host_about: father, nd football avid fan, dog lover...very quiet....

description:
Watch the sunrise at The East Point Cedar House. Your private swim-friendly beach getaway! Located in the quiet town of Cape Tormentine, this 3 bed, dog-friendly home offers AC, a gazebo and a 300 ft private, sandy beach. Ideal for groups up to 6 looking to relax and unwind. The Cape offers a small community grocer (summer) at the campground within walking. 1 King bed, 1 Queen bed, 2 Single beds. Wifi has been upgraded to Starlink.

45 min: Shediac, Sackville, 1 hr: Moncton, Charlottetown.
neighborhood_overview: We are located on 2 acres and 300 ft of oceanfront. To location is quiet and spacious.
host_about: Hi there. I'm a female professional that loves to travel. I was born and raised in Ontario but lived out west for 14 years, and now find myself on the East Coast. name: Bay Watch Cottage,  on the Bay of Fundy
description:
Amazing location on a quiet road, on the Bay of Fundy. Relax, unwind and be present Enjoy the true east coast slow living vibe and leave the world behind. Bay Watch cottage is a cozy, century home, in south western New Brunswick.
Perfect for families, couples and weekend getaways.
Walking to nearby beach to search for sea glass, sand dollars, hermit crabs.
*Saint John 30 mins
*St. Andrews 40 mins
*New River Beach 1 0 min
*Hopewell Rocks 2.5 hours
neighborhood_overview: Maces Bay is an old fishing village, with beautiful coastal views. The area is safe and quiet. There is a small gas station within 2km, and a larger Irving Grab & Go Convenience + NB Liquor, located 3.2km away. Myrtle's Pizza is a local favorite for take out and eat on the cottage deck, or head to the Bay Breeze in Pocologan for east coast fare on their ocean front patio in a casual setting. Head down the street at low tide to a family & dog friendly beach to search for sea glass, sand dollars and hermit crabs.  The basin peninsula is a great place for a short walk, or to launch sea kayaks, and bird watch. Bald eagles nest annually on the islands, and often fly over head.
host_about:
Hi! We are Tracy and John O’Neill.

John is a Caper, and Tracy grew up in a military family, frequently moving. We are both retired military, spending much of our careers on the east coast.
We have 3 children, and our youngest is about to leave the nest. 
We're passionate about animals, especially dogs, and travelling. 
We strive to make Baywatch cottage the epitome of the east coast lifestyle.  Slow, uninterrupted, and completely relaxing.

name: Saltbox by the Sea
description:
This old house is a gem, in the heart of St Andrews! Walking distance to the amazing shops, restaurants and pubs!
Since 2021 we have replaced the roof, siding and windows, done the patio, driveway and installed a new furnace. We renovated to make a master bedroom and full bathroom on the main floor. We installed stacking laundry on the main floor and a patio door to the kitchen. Two bedrooms upstairs have been renovated fully.
The yard is big and beautiful with deer roaming through most days!
neighborhood_overview:
This house is the perfect location in St Andrews! Bring your walking shoes! All within 6 block radius:
Algonquin Hotel restaurant and pub
Kingsbrae Gardens, KIRA amphitheatre and cafe
Art shops/studios, Antique shops
Clothing/gift shops
Pubs and restaurants - regular live music
Independent grocery, Home Hardware, Guardian Pharmacy, Scotiabank, Liquor Store
Market square (weekly market)
Wharf
Whale watching tour companies
host_about: We love to travel together or with our four children when we have time around their many activities!  We prefer to stay in cottages or apartments rather than hotels when travelling.  We have rented out our apartments for 3 years and enjoy the many different people that we have met during their stays, whether in London for work or pleasure.  We look forward to meeting many new faces through connections on Airbnb through our own travel and others visiting us.

name: Sydney on the Square
description:
Nestled next to one of the city's most desirable parks, Sydney offers you luxurious comfort.
"Queen Square was once one of the most fashionable districts in the City. The homes were built by wealthy citizens following the Great Fire of 1877."
Accommodating up to 8 guests, Sydney provides the perfect escape for family or friends, or a dreamy backdrop for your wedding day preparations. Please see the “Neighbourhood” section for parking information.
neighborhood_overview:
Parking is free on the street in front of the airbnb. You just have to make sure to follow the following rules:
- From 8am to 6pm your vehicle must be moved every two hours to avoid a ticket. This can be rolling forward or backward a couple meters.
- Parking is free and unlimited (no need to move your car), in the evening between 6pm and 8am, on weekends and holidays.

Alternatively you can contact the city parking commission for instruction on how to purchase a daily/weekly parking pass.
host_about: I'm a busy mom of 4 :) I grew up in family-owned hospitality businesses and spent many of my adult years working in the industry. Nothing has ever made more sense than to host people, whether in Airbnb or in my other business ventures.

name: West Wing on the Water ~ Luxury Getaway on a Lake
description:
Enjoy this breathtaking lakeside getaway at Baker Lake, NB. This spectacular 4-season private family resort is your oasis of tranquility & adventure.

Stroll or hike the sprawling grounds. Swim, paddle, fish or skate the lake. Explore surrounding mountainous trails into NB, Quebec or Maine on your ATV, sleds or Side-by-Side.

Relax in the private hot tub (seasonal) or retreat to enjoy the fireplaces, dining & entertaining areas of your expansive 2-BR, 2-level luxury suite.
neighborhood_overview:
Lac Baker, New Brunswick is a picturesque oasis of nature. Small, forested mountains encircle this idyllic, pristine lake.

The area is renowned for snowmobiling, boating, skiing, fishing, hunting, ice fishing, swimming, mountain hiking or fat biking, or quad and side-by-Side touring the trails that spread out into Quebec, New Brunswick and even Maine.

The lake itself is 7 kilometres in length, with several islands to explore, and spreads into both Quebec and New Brunswick.

Sled and ATV trails are accessible within minutes of the property, which is 40 minutes from Edmunston for shopping amenities, or to Mount Farlagne for downhill skiing.

Situated in a quiet corner of Western New Brunswick, Baker Lake is a perfect gateway to the Atlantic Provinces or place to spend as a base for day trips exploring the surrounding beautiful terrain.

Many find it an ideal gathering place for family and friends from Ontario and Nova Scotia to meet in

name: Cozy Oceanfront Cottage with Stunning Views!
description: Welcome to Driftwood Harbour, where charm meets tranquility! Nestled directly on the Northumberland Strait, this renovated 2-storey cottage offers breathtaking views & gorgeous oceanfront making it a true Canadian gem. Dive into relaxation with backyard swims or cozy up by the fireplace with a good book. Explore nearby attractions, golf courses, & wineries. It's the ultimate home away from home, conveniently located just 25 mins from Shediac, 35 mins from Moncton, & a mere 8 mins from Cap-Pele.
neighborhood_overview:
Driftwood Harbour Lighthouse is situated in a small fishing village located in Southeastern New Brunswick known for the warmth of its people. This village is without a doubt a rare find for tourists seeking adventure.

The richness of the Acadian culture and its heritage contribute in making a colourful fishing village. During the herring, scallop and lobster fishing season more than 60 boats unload these delicacies of the sea. Petit-Cap has built its reputation on the aroma stemming from over thirty smoke houses (you can often smell a campfire scent.)

In the heart of l’Acadie, violins, singing, dancing, and fireworks are all part of the air of celebration that goes on throughout the year. During the summer season, the village’s sandy beaches are among the most beautiful in Eastern Canada, and the water is the warmest, north of the Carolinas.

A short drive will place you at Marché au Corner Market, Irving Oil & Esso gas stations, Canada Post, Smokehous
host_about: Hi! I’m Kayla, a mom of three, passionate about travel and all things real estate. I love making my space a cozy, welcoming retreat for guests. Can't wait to host you!

name: Cozy Cottage (w/ bunkhouse! Up to 6 guests!)
description:
2 bedroom Year Round Cottage with Seasonal Bunkhouse ! New Hot Tub!

Lose yourself in Nature. Private cottage located just a few minutes' walk from Washademoak Lake. This is a rural property! Perfect for a romantic getaway or a family retreat. The cottage sleeps 4 comfortably. The Bunkhouse opens May through October and acts as a third bedroom that can host an additional two persons.


Centrally located, Sussex, SJ, Moncton and Fredericton are all 60 minutes or less away.
neighborhood_overview:
This property is located on Mill Brook which flows into Big Cove at Washademoak Lake. In the summer our guests can paddle onto Washademoak Lake from our front yard ! Larger boats may need to be launched directly into Washademoak Lake from Nickerson Point Road ( the next street over).

The area is peaceful and quiet and lends to recreational and seasonal users.
host_about:
Greetings From Yellowknife, NT.

I have lived in the north since 2008 (after growing up in eastern Canada). These years have been some of my life's most exciting, magical, and rewarding.

name: Authentic Acadian home on 1 acre property
description: Live a true authentic Acadian experience in La Maison McLaughlin! Ideal for families or groups of friends looking for a vacation in the Acadian Peninsula. neighborhood_overview:
La Maison McLaughlin is located in a friendly neighbourhood on the main road. It is 2 minutes away from nearest bypass entrance and exit, 2 minutes from Driving Range Tracadie and 7 minutes away from Val-Comeau beach. There is also a car wash right next to the house. The downtown area is a 5-minute car ride, where you’ll be able to find grocery stores, restaurants and bars/pubs. You can enjoy a walk along the Tracadie river, by parking where the information centre is.

Walking distance : Gymnasia (weightlifting gym - 3 minutes), La Boutique Acadienne (Acadian souvenir shop - 6 minutes), Dépanneur C.M. (corner store - 14 minutes)

name: Waterfront Retreat, Beach, Pool & Nat'l Park!
description:
Enjoy the spectacular views of sparkling waters, birds and boats from this beautiful waterfront beach-house!
Stroll along your backyard beach, take a dip in the resort-shared pool and hot tub, grill fresh-caught eats on the BBQ, make memories at the fire-pit, catch the sunset and be dazzled by the stars.
Breathe in summer at it's best! Take a short drive to Kouchibouguac Nat'l Park for EPIC hikes, kayaks and fat bikes! Enjoy small town flavour at this relaxing & refreshing waterfront re-treat!
neighborhood_overview:
Perfectly located 15 minutes from the National Park of Kouchibouguac for hikes, kayaking and fat bikes, 10 minutes to boat tours to see the seals and dunes, 20 minutes to the Bouctouche Sand Dunes, Pays de la Sagouine, Golf Courses. Just 45 minutes to the Hub of the Maritimes, Moncton offers Shopping, Dining, Casino, Spas, the fun filled Magnetic Hill and Water Park. At just over an hour's drive you'll find the world famous Hopewell Rocks boasting the highest tides in the world! This chalet has everything to keep you exploring or simply enjoying the view from this unique perspective in paradise.

Enjoy all the local attractions around such as the Marina, the Fisherman's Wharf, Boutiques, Shops and local Restaurants. Take a short walk to the quaint downtown of Richibucto for some ice-cream, fresh-caught lobster and other Maritime home cooking!

The chalet is located on a Resort Chalet Pointe! It offers offers private beaches, amazing amenities including a shared poo
host_about:
As a host who loves to travel, I strive to create memorable experiences for my guests who visit our little slice of paradise. I make myself available to recommend local experiences and to enhance your stay however possible. I can also leave you your space and allow you to soak up the good times!

My work takes me across the world and I therefore have great contacts all over. With my extensive online experiences, I've decided to start renting out my properties and those of other people that are looking to make their property become an income generator.

If i'm staying at your place, rest assured that I will treat like my own and leave it cleaner than when I arrived. I usually do the turnover as that is what I would wish for. ;)

As a host or property manager, I make sure your stay is comfortable, enjoyable and memorable. 

I look forward to hosting you and making you feel at home. 

I speak English, French and Spanish and I am available for any questions at all times.
Have a great stay!

name: *Once Upon a Tide* Waterfront Escape
description:
Welcome to Once Upon a Tide. We are located on a quiet road on the water's edge in Cocagne; a charming village along the Acadian Coast. Our newly renovated private waterfront cottage is located on an acre of land with an amazing panoramic view of Cocagne Bay and is perfect for vacations, weekend getaways, and special occasions for families, couples, or friends meeting up on the east coast.
Experience comfort and tranquility, while still enjoying many close tourist destinations.
neighborhood_overview:
Cocagne was named after Cockaigne, a mythical paradise meaning "land of abundance" in medieval French literature. It is located at the mouth of the Cocagne River on the Northumberland Strait and was founded in 1767.

Cocagne is a peaceful coastal village with all amenities around. We are 3 minutes from the grocery store, take-out restaurants, and gas station plus close to the pharmacy. We are conveniently located between Parlee Beach in Shediac and La Dune de Bouctouche. You can enjoy both with a short drive :)
host_about:
My husband and I live in beautiful Grand Barachois NB with our three kids and our big English Lab. We originally bought our cottage to renovate for my parents to live in but plans quickly changed as we were recently blessed with another sweet boy. 

We are big travel and outdoor enthusiasts and try to discover new places often and like to think of ourselves as savvy travellers. 

We are trying to bring up our children to value experiences over "things" and have discovered what we can't live without (besides my family itself) being by the water, sunsets and sunshine. 

We know very well what it's like to be a traveller so we will try to be as accommodating as possible with our guests. We have strong roots in the Maritimes and have lived in multiple cities so please don't hesitate to ask for recommendations!

I look forward to hosting you and making you feel at home and am available for any questions at all times.

I would also like to welcome you to New Brunswick, to our beautiful slice of Paradise :)

Please have a great stay!

name: Serenity By The Sea: The Coleman Cottage
description:
Looking for a cozy place to stay this spring and summer with all the amenities?

We have it here!

We are located in downtown Alma; walking distance to all the restaurants, shops, grocery store. We are only steps away from the beach featuring the tides of the Bay of Fundy and the beautiful Fundy National Park.

There is so much to do, hiking, biking, boating, and more to fill those beautiful sunny days.

For Pet Policy, fees and expectations, please go to "Other Details to Note"
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage was originally built in 1884 and was located in Point Wolfe in Fundy Park. It arrived at its present location on a barge that floated down the bay. Today it is located along the Upper Salmon River which is fed by the Bay of Fundy as the tide comes in right in downtown Alma. There are lots of homes/cottages/restaurants etc in the immediate area, and you are only seconds away from the entry to Fundy Park. You will need a park pass if you plan to enjoy all the park has to offer - In the summer, you have the pool, lakes, biking, hiking, fishing and exploring! In the winter months you will find our location at the base of the snow mobile trail on one end of the street and the gas station/corner store on the other end. We also have a large driveway that's perfect for parking your sleds.
There are also many other winter activities available, snow shoeing, cross country skiing, and often the ice skating rink in town is ready to go!

name: Amazing Ocean front home
description: This amazing Beresford home will not disappoint you.  Whether you want to relax and enjoy the views from the windows or you want sit in the backyard patio by the fire or pull up a beach chair on your own beach, you will relax in this spectacular home. Sat - Sat bookings 7 night minimum.  For Sep - May bookings please contact for bookings. Thank you!
neighborhood_overview:
This is a family friendly beach neighborhood that is close to many amenities; grocery store, restaurants, Tim Hortons!

Visit Beresford Beach (located 2 mins. walk from this property) is one of the most popular attractions in the Chaleur Region. Adjacent to the City of Bathurst, it’s the perfect place to relax, bathe in the sun and swim. The birds, the plant life, the sea and the largest salt marsh in the Chaleur Region afford plenty of opportunities for those who like to observe and photograph nature. Visitors can take advantage of the walking trails, two wooden boardwalks and the observation tower. Enjoy festivals and special events, the Farmers’ Market, the outdoor beach theater and youth activities.

Beresford Beach is an unsupervised saltwater beach with washrooms, picnic tables, canteen, a park, toys for children and an outdoor stage. Musical entertainment is provided throughout the summer season on Sunday afternoons, Wednesday evenings and during special eve

name: Seaside 4 Bedroom Downtown Duplex Farmhouse
description: Welcome to  serene riverside Airbnb, nestled along the enchanting tourist walking trail! Experience tranquility amidst nature's embrace. Relax to the gentle melody of flowing waters, unwind in cozy accommodations, and rejuvenate your spirit.  Book now and let the river weave its magic around you! 🌿Unwind after a long day in the bathroom jacuzzi...and nestle in to your comfy bed for the night. The space is the White/red duplex.  SPECIAL PRICES FOR TRAVEL NURSES.
neighborhood_overview: The space is very private in summer.  And close to about everything in area being it is situated off the tourist area of town just a minutes walk down street.  Also has a beach trail right across street for leisure strolls to enjoy the sunsets in evening or in early morning.  The back yard is magical and very private..apples trees, garden, pool...great seating area to sit around fire pit.  There are many beautiful bnb's in area...but this back yard in summer just cannot be beat.
host_about: I always want my guests to feel welcome.  I teach painting here in Campbellton.  I also run a small business Sweet Giggles Candy Apples and Confection. Historic Museums
Whale Watching
And much much more
host_about: We are parents who love to entertain and travel with our family and friends. Over the years we have enjoyed staying in many Airbnbs and took note of all the things each place had that we liked. In 2021 we fell in love with St Andrews, NB and knew that we wanted a home away from home there. It took us a year to find and equip the perfect home but it was worth the wait. We are thrilled to be able to host and share our vacation home with others.

name: Cottage in Scotchtown, Grand Lake, NB
description: Welcome to Grand Lake! Newly renovated cottage on a gorgeous lakefront setting. Wake up to a beautiful view of the lake from the master bedroom. Your days can spent be on the private beach or in the screened in porch. When nighttime rolls around, fire up the barbecue and enjoy the view. Or take a short trip down the road for fresh produce, Harbour 1 Stop or gourmet pizzas at Berties. End the evening with a campfire gazing at the stars. Owners next door. Quiet renters welcomed. No parties
neighborhood_overview:
Located on Grand Lake, Schotchtown NB
Some local businesses in the area:
*Schotchtown Farms were you can buy fresh produce, baked goods and flowers.
*Birdie's Cafe. Open Thursday -Sunday. Enjoy wood fired pizzas (pizza is summer only) daily homemade breakfast and lunch features, lattes, Whitney coffee and gourmet desserts.
*Harbour 1 Stop convenience for all your gas, chip, anything you forgot to pack, they likely have it! NB liquor agency store onsite and a canteen stand(canteen open from Victoria Day weekend- Labour Day weekend).

name: Cast Away Grand Lodge….luxury 4 bedroom w/hot tub
description:
Just Breathe! The Grand Lodge is everything you need to relax and unwind! Spoil yourself and catch the sunrise from the hot tub! This unique waterfront luxury cabin has a style all its own & comes fully equipped for a relaxing getaway!

Mins away from the Village of Blackville where you will find a grocery store, hardware store, local restaurants, Gas/Convenience/Liquor Store.

Mins from ATV/Snowmobile trail & the Blackville Park.

*Surveillance on ring doorbell & porch pointing at the driveway.
host_about:
Hi….I’m Beth.  I’m a “military brat” who lived and travelled all over the world growing up.  Many of my summers were spent on the Mighty Miramichi, where my mom and generations before her were born.  I loved spending time with my Grandparents here, and have many fond memories of these New Brunswick summers. 
My Uncle and Aunt recently moved back to the Miramichi and ventured into the vacation rental business.  They opened up Cast Away Vacation rentals in May of 2020 and have thoroughly enjoyed helping guests create special and memorable vacations on the beautiful Miramichi River.
My husband Mike and I (with our three children) have decided to jump on board with the intent to carry on creating these exciting experiences for guests at the Lodge and at our newest property the Grand Lodge. 
We are pleased and proud to be assuming the reins of Cast Away Vacation Rentals in September of 2022.  We look forward to hosting you, your family and friends very soon!!!
~Beth and Mike

name: Historic Edwardian Carriage House Ample Parking
description: The Gardeners Cottage in Saint Andrews New Brunswick is a place that's both historic and one of a kind.  Listed in the Canadian registry of historical places and designed by the prominent Maxwell Brothers Architects for the Ogilvie wheat baron F.W. Thompson. Part of the carriage house and stables building on the estate, the gardeners cottage was the home to the groomsmen and gardeners. In the shadow of the Algonquin Hotel close to Katy's Cove and walk-able to downtown Saint Andrews by the Sea.
neighborhood_overview: In the shadow of the mighty Algonquin Hotel The Gardeners Cottage is steps from the town tennis courts and a short walk to Katy's Cove! A very walk-able neighborhood with full time residents nearby. The popular Antique store Macklem House is very close, stop in to pick up a vintage souvenir. Historic Water Street is a quick jaunt down to the shore.  If you need your morning coffee fix Tim Hortons is just a couple of blocks away.

name: The Buck Stops Here cozy cottage
description: We are the perfect pet friendly destination during the months of May-October. We are nestled in the hillside, surrounded by forest & wildlife. When given the opportunity, this is the perfect escape to view many of the deer that live here during winter months. Enjoy late night fires, star gazing, afternoon BBQ's or a day of adventure hiking, snowshoeing, wheeling or snowmobiling. You decide it's your vacation to enjoy! Great news, the Skedaddle Ridge trails are only 2 kms from our cottage!
neighborhood_overview: You will find our neighborhood  immaculately well kept and tidy. Everyone  in our community takes pride in their homes and cottages.  This area provides seasonal and year round living. Many of the people who visit or live here are retired, and their cottage is their home away from home. The drive through our little community is so beautiful.  Twinkling lights on trees, chairs at the waters edge of the stream, and most evenings you will see people enjoying their campfire after a fun day out exploring. Those who visit can't wait to return.
host_about: Hi my name is Tina. My husbands name is Chad. We have a daughter, granddaughter and 2 very spoiled cats. I love photography, travelling, wood crafts, organizing, and baking. My husband enjoys the great outdoors, carpentry, mechanics, electrician and plumbing. We both love to ATV. In the winter months we enjoy caring for the deer, which is very rewarding! Meeting our guests and sharing stories & experiences is why I love "The Buck Stops Here".

name: Fundy Living -      Lambert's Cove Lookout
description: Make special memories at this unique and beautiful place, which provides the ultimate in privacy, quiet, and space. Experience the world's highest tides, surrounded by nature and beautiful sunsets. Bird lovers, artists, photographers, and families seeking something exceptional will find what they are looking for. Located on 7 private acres with hundreds of feet of shoreline, this listing gives up to 7 people (up to 4 adults and 3 children) a central location to experience all the area offers.
neighborhood_overview: West Isles Parish, Deer Island, New Brunswick is a collection of small beautiful villages. Most permanent inhabitants are working commercial fishermen. Lamberts Cove, like most villages is named after an historic family.  It is one of the smaller communities and as such provides more tranquility and enjoyment of the abundant natural beauty.  In the distance one can see the salmon aquaculture on the Passamaquoddy Bay.  Closer in to the residence are two houses across the Cove which can actually be visited by walking the Cove when the tide is out.  St Andrews by the Sea is visible across the water. Clams can be dug in the cove. Your hosts can help you learn how to do it.

name: Parlee Paradise
description: Relaxation is unavoidable at this quaint, family-friendly retreat within walking distance of Parlee Beach. Cuddle up in the cozy sunroom during rain storms, sway in the net swings on the patio with a book in hand, and recline on a deck chair next to a crackling fire while the kids roast marshmallows. Grab some of the provided beach chairs and towels and stroll down to Parlee Beach to enjoy the soft sand and warm, shallow waters of one of the region's most beautiful beaches.
host_about: My family has owned the Hemlock Road property since I was eight years old and I spent every summer here as a child. name: The Sharpbrook  in Lower Millstream
description:
Welcome to our beautiful, rustic country house surrounded by acres of farmland. The Sharpbrook is a quick 15 minute drive to Sussex, NB where there are countless restaurants, unique shops and hiking trails to enjoy. Poley Mountain is less than 30 minutes away where you can experience Atlantic Canadas family favourite ski resort! The Sharpbrook is conveniently located between 3 major cities: Moncton, Saint John and Fredericton.
Our classic farmhouse exudes warmth, charm & character.
neighborhood_overview:
This home is located in beautiful, quiet, farming community. Expect the occasional tractor driving by and friendly farmers working in the surrounding fields during your visit.
Our dairy farm is located directly next to this home which has been in our family since 1810; making our farm one of the oldest in the area. Sharp Brook Flower Farm is also located beside this property & offers U-Pick flower experiences during the summer months.

name: Hot tub getaway with sunset and river views
description:
Relax with your morning coffee on your deck while contemplating your day .
Is it a tube float down the river starting from our place down to the beach? Perhaps a canoe rental for a few hours down the famous Restigouche River. How about a drive into Campbellton and visiting the fabulous waterfront. An evening BBQ and perhaps some of that fresh East Coast lobster that you bought for dinner. Anyone for some smores at the firepit🔥? End the night with a hot tub and some star gazing? ❤️
neighborhood_overview:
Make your way down to the huge river for a swim. Bring a tube and make your way down the river.

Peaceful with few neighbors spread out. Stunning views for as far as you can see. Your away from town and really in the outdoors. Closest town (Tide Head) is 15 minutes away.

Hi my name is Kristine and I'm excited to be hosting on Airbnb.

name: Union House
description:
Union House is our family home, as we split our time between two cities. We love the open concept and the kitchen bar where large and little ones can tuck up for a snack or a chat. The living room is like one big pillow (with TV attached). There's a cupboard full of games, art supplies, and books for all ages.

At Union House, we have tried to make it most everything you would need to have a proper staycation. Cozy, bright, and beautiful is why we love it; we think you will too :)
neighborhood_overview:
Centrally located, Union House is a 5 minute walk from downtown shops, the 5 Kings craft restaurant and brewhouse, and the Garcelon indoor public pool (and sauna!).

We are also a 5 minute walk from the Elm Street nature park and Dover Hill park, both offering wonderful hikes in river valleys, with stunning views of the St Croix rapids. There is also a lovely river walk which starts behind Something's Brewing Cafe.

Don't hesitate to ask us for recommendations on hikes, beaches, and restaurants outside of St. Stephen as well. We know all the swimming holes and sand beaches, as well as the best spots for fish and chips. The resort town of St. Andrews by the Sea is a gorgeous 20 minute drive away, as you follow the St. Croix river from St. Stephen out to the Fundy Bay, where St. Andrews is perched on the end of a peninsula.
host_about: I'm a life partner and a father of 3 boys. I'm a researcher and a writer and an artist.

name: Riverview Countryside Farmhouse, King bed Spa Bath
description: Welcome to your perfect, private, cozy, family friendly, newly renovated, four season, modern farmhouse, for a large family, or two, or group. King bed on main level. This home overlooks the Kouchibouguacis River, where you can canoe, kayak or boat. The entertainers deck stairs lead you to the custom made fire pit, get your s’mores & hot chocolate ready & star gaze.
neighborhood_overview: We are 5 minutes away from the entrance to the Kouchibouguac National Park. You can rent fat bikes, canoes and go to Kelly's Beach in the spring and summer. You can also rent fat bikes in the winter,  cross country ski, walk the beautiful trails which is spectacular at night, no light pollution. There are several warm up  buildings with a cozy wood stove to get warm in. There are many ATV and snow mobile trails all around us.  Tennis courts are nearby as well. The local winery is 10 minutes away. There are 3 golf courses from 10 - 30 minutes away.  Saint-Louis has amazing history. It hosts the largest Acadian Flag in the world.

name: Tranquil lake house retreat at Washademoak Lake
description:
Discover The Lake House in the Narrows – a year-round family retreat with a short 3-minute walk to the lake.

Swimming, paddleboarding, kayaking, and fishing are right at your doorstep,
and nearby hiking and ATV trails.

Winter lovers will find delight in our nearby snowmobiling and snowshoeing trails, and evenings spent cozying up by the fire.

Embrace the serenity of the great outdoors while enjoying all the comforts of home. Discover the perfect balance of relaxation and adventure with us.
neighborhood_overview:
This year-round home is in the heart of New Brunswick's cottage country. The Panty Ranch is on a private laneway that ends at beautiful Washademoak Lake, where it's all about outdoor life. Enjoy all 4 seasons while having all the modern comforts to return to when you're done boating, kayaking, snowmobiling, ATVing, or hiking in the woods watching the eagles play.

There is a corner store where you can pick up just about any necessities 3 km away.
host_about:
Hi there! I’m Jenn, a long-time resident of Canada’s-voted-best-city-to-live Burlington.
I grew up in a small town called Beamsville in the heart of the Niagara Wine region, so I had no choice but to learn a thing or 2 about winemaking (and tasting!) growing up.  

I graduated from McMaster University as a musician, but I’m also a fitness & nutrition coach, with a WFH day job in the real estate industry. 

Whether you’re looking for some recommendations on wineries to tour or fun active adventures I’m happy to share my favourites with you!

name: Cory Cottage - a charming 1830s home w ocean views
description:
Welcome to Cory Cottage – your ideal retreat in the heart of St. Andrews-by-the-Sea. Just a short stroll from town and adjacent to the Algonquin Hotel, our charming cottage offers four ensuite bedrooms, inviting living and dining spaces with fireplaces, a chef’s kitchen, and picturesque ocean views from the kitchen and rear decks. Whether it's a family vacation, a girls' getaway, a golf weekend, or a corporate retreat, our versatile haven caters to every occasion.

Find us @corycottage
neighborhood_overview: "Nestled in the heart of St. Andrews, a designated National Historic Site, Cory Cottage provides a charming retreat just a short stroll away from the town's rich tapestry of history, breathtaking architecture, and vibrant marine life. This idyllic destination is a haven for enthusiasts of whale watching, golfing, tennis, botanical wonders at Kingsbrae Gardens, exploring historic sites like Ministers Island, immersing in marine science at Huntsman Marine Science Centre and Aquarium, enjoying the pristine waters at Katys Cove, and indulging in the diverse culinary delights and unique shops that grace this seaside gem. With something for everyone, Cory Cottage invites you to effortlessly embrace the allure of this coastal haven."

name: Sit back and relax in this quiet country setting
description: Absolutely a great quiet place to sit back and relax in the country, located right beside the Upsalquitch River equipped with a 70-inch flat screen TV and unlimited high-speed internet from starlink. name: Grandview on the lake-lac Unique
description: (NOTE Sleeps 3 in winter) Beautiful private cabin on over an acre sitting on the peaceful waters of lac Unique. Sit back and listen to the loons calling as the sun glistens. Surrounded by trees, you will feel secluded from the rest of the world. The main cabin has one bedroom with queen size bed plus rollaway bed. The charming SEASONAL bunkie has a queen size bed and twin trundle. Take the  canoe  out to catch the sunsets as you enjoy all the beauty this area offers.
neighborhood_overview: Lac Unique is a 300 acre lake perfect for boating, fishing , swimming and canoeing. The community boat launch is a 2 min drive from the cabin. Around Lac Unique is extensive Atv and snowmobile trails to explore right from the property. Saint Francois is 10 min drive and has a gas station , grocery store and hardware store for all your needs. Nearby Clair has Goodies cafe for the best muffins and ice cream around. Edmunston is less than 45 min away where you will find larger box stores and grocery stores Quebec City is less than 3 hours away for day trips.
host_about: Love traveling the world and sharing it with my girls. Believe in love, peace and moments. “Life is not measured by amount of breaths we take but by the moments that take our breath away”

name: The Lodge at Exmoor/Rustic Beauty
description: The Lodge is a unique experience and one you won't forget. Beautiful and serene panoramic views set on top of a  hillside overlooking the valley and the northwest branch of the Miramichi river.  Its a great place to gather as family with lots of room, also quiet place to fish with friends or to share a special occasion with loved ones. Roasting marshmallows, swimming in the river and watching the sunset are what memories are made of.
neighborhood_overview:
--THE SPACE--

Quiet place to relax and enjoy the sunrise and sunsets.
Firepit for night time guitar magic by moonlight
Fire places in all three cabins
The whole lodge sleeps 16 people. There is one queen bed, the rest are single beds.

There are 6 separate sleeping spaces and 3 full bathrooms with showers

The Lodge is a 2 night minimum

Open season May 1st-October 31st

--GUEST ACCESS--

Access to main dining lodge and lower Lodge with 10 or less rentals required. Access to overflow quarters with 11 or more rentals required.

--OTHER THINGS TO NOTE--

Fire wood is free

There is a $160 cleaning fee.

There is 1 double kayak and one single kayak and one canoe to use for free. If you take the kayak, you use it at your own risk and replacement will be expected if it is lost or damaged. The bogan is perfect for kayaks. Life jackets are available and are alway recommended.
host_about: I'm a mother and an empty nester. I love reading and the beach. I sell John Deere tractors as a job, but I love our Lodge and find it peaceful.

description: Escape to the Miramichi River with our 2-bedroom waterfront home. Including heated garage, this retreat sleeps a total of 7. neighborhood_overview: Tucked away next to the water with ample space between you and the neighbours provides lots of privacy.

name: Chalet De Grande-Digue
description: Chalet de Grande-Digue is a cozy cottage located in the village of Grande-Digue, New Brunswick. Perfect for families or friends seeking a peaceful getaway from the city, the cottage boasts a spacious living area with an outdoor deck surrounded by trees. fully equipped kitchen with amenities and a dining area seating up to six people. Outside,there is a spacious yard provides ample space for outdoor activities Enjoy a tranquil vacation in the serene setting of Chalet de Grande-Digue.
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet and Residential: The area around Grande-Digue is primarily residential, providing a tranquil and family-friendly environment. It's an ideal place for those seeking a quieter lifestyle away from the hustle and bustle of larger cities.

Close-Knit Community: Grande-Digue has a close-knit community spirit, where neighbours often come together for local events, festivals, and community initiatives. The residents take pride in maintaining a friendly and welcoming atmosphere.

The neighbourhood reflects the Acadian heritage of the region, and French is commonly spoken alongside English. The Acadian culture is celebrated through various events, music, and cuisine, adding a unique charm to the area.

Overall, Grande-Digue presents an opportunity to live in a serene coastal neighbourhood with a keen sense of community, natural beauty, and convenient access to nearby towns and services.

Located in the heart of Richibucto, you'll be close to everything when you stay at our vibrant bayside retreat.

Stroll down the main strip for a fresh seafood meal & ice cream for dessert, fish along the Richibucto River, splash in the salt water or if that's too cold, take a dip in your own seasonally heated private pool. Finish off the day warming up by the outdoor firepit with some s'mores!

description: If you like privacy, space and stunning views come stay with us! This four-season home has lots of space for a large family with four bedrooms and an extra loft space. Great fishing, beach access and lots of space for outdoor games.
neighborhood_overview: Grande Digue is a small coastal community located in Kent County, New Brunswick and home to quiet and beautiful sandy beaches. A short drive from a small market store with fresh fruits, veggies and baked goods (Les Digues) as well as a seafood market (Joe Caissie). Shediac and Parlee Beach Provincial Park are just a twenty minute drive while for larger amenities Moncton is only 40 minutes from the cottage. The Dunes of Bouctouche are only 30 minutes away.

Within 5 Minute walk to Parlee Beach and the Wharf.

This Beach Home Sleeps 7
-Bedroom 1: Queen Size Bed, Closet Cabinets

neighborhood_overview:
Parlee Beach: Located within a 5-minute walking distance, Parlee Beach is a must-visit destination. With its pristine sandy beaches and warm waters, it's an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, and beachside picnics. Enjoy beach volleyball, build sandcastles, or take a leisurely stroll along the shoreline. The beach also offers amenities like changing rooms, washrooms, and a canteen for your convenience!

The Point-du-Chene Wharf and Restaurants: Located near Parlee Beach, within a 5-minute walking distance the Wharf is a charming waterfront area bustling with activity. Explore a variety of local restaurants that serve up delicious seafood dishes, from freshly caught lobster and oysters to mouthwatering fish and chips. Enjoy picturesque views of the marina as you savour your meal. Take a leisurely walk along the wharf, watching the fishing boats come and go, or browse through the quaint shops offering unique local crafts and souvenirs. The Wharf is the perfect place to immers
host_about: My name is Jessica, with love for my incredible family, and a devoted husband by my side, we navigate the beautiful chaos of parenthood together, blessed with four precious children. Our home is alive with the joyful energy of three mischievous cats and one faithful, tail-wagging dog.

name: ~Country Getaway~Goat Farmstay~ @BlueMoonAcres
description:
A PEACEFUL COUNTRY GETAWAY ON A WORKING GOAT FARM.

Enjoy your morning coffee sitting out on the covered deck watching the goats graze peacefully in the nearby pasture. (Seasonal)

The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to cook up a delicious home cooked meal.

Enjoy the animals up close or from a distance, whichever you prefer. Join us for chores and help feed the animals, maybe collect some eggs or take a break and enjoy some baby goat snuggles! (If interested just ask)
neighborhood_overview: Quiet country setting. The airbnb sits on 100 acres of farmland and forest. There is a cow pasture across the road and a goat pasture beside the airbnb. We are located on a dead end road so there is usually very little traffic. Because of our proximity to the forest and fields, you could potentially see bear, deer, moose, coyote, fox, skunk, porcupine, raccoon, mice, squirrel, frog, turtle, spider, mosquito, wasp, bees, blackflies, hawk, eagle and many other types of wild animals or insects. While we do our absolute best to keep as many of these away from our property as possible, nature rules in the countryside.
host_about: We both come from human service councillor backgrounds. We love homesteading and growing our own food and are excited to share our farm life with our guests!

name: Waterfront 3-bedroom duplex, hot tub, 10 guests.
description: 🌟Welcome to our waterfront 3-bedroom upper duplex, featuring a hot tub overlooking panoramic views of the Restigouche River and the Appalachian Mountains. Situated near snowmobiling and four-wheeling trails, this retreat is ideal for outdoor enthusiasts, offering access to skiing 🎿, fishing🎣, hiking 🥾, biking🚴‍♂️, golfing⛳, and more. Whether you're soaking in the hot tub or exploring the great outdoors, Chalet Levesque provides an ideal blend of relaxation and adventure for up to 10 guests.
neighborhood_overview:
-Scenic Natural Beauty 🌄: The neighbourhood is characterized by stunning panoramic views of the Restigouche River and the Appalachian Mountains, providing a serene and picturesque backdrop for your stay.
-Outdoor Activities 🎿: The area offers a wealth of year-round outdoor activities. In winter, enjoy skiing, ice fishing, hockey, snowboarding, and access to provincial snowmobiling trails. During the summer, take advantage of fishing, hiking, biking, and golfing opportunities.
-Restigouche Golf Course ⛳: Located just 4 km away, this golf course offers a relaxing and enjoyable golfing experience amidst beautiful scenery.
-Sugarloaf Provincial Park 🏞️: A short 6 km drive brings you to this park, which features mountain biking, skiing, and hiking trails suitable for all skill levels, making it a great destination for outdoor enthusiasts.
-Campbellton City Center 🏙️: Only 2 km away, the city center offers a variety of local pubs, dining options, and entertainment venues,
host_about: Hello! I'm Maxime, a high school teacher and hockey coach dedicated to igniting young minds. Alongside my amazing wife, Vanessa, a compassionate nurse practitioner, we're passionate hospitality entrepreneurs invested in providing both short-term and long-term rentals. As the proud father of an energetic 3-year-old son and a baby girl, our home is filled with love and excitement. We're thrilled to share our Chalet with you! Enjoy!

name: Dieppe - 5 BD - Homey Spot Near YQM Country Fest
description:
Welcome to your centrally located 5 bedroom home in Dieppe! This home is a 5 min walk to the Champlain Place Mall and a 10 min walk to the Dieppe Farmer's Market! The Greater Moncton Airport is a 10 min drive (7km) away.

The Champlain Place Mall is a central public transportation hub. The buses can take you to Université de Moncton or NBCC in 10 mins!

This home features high speed wifi, a 55 inch smart tv, a king bed, 4 seater dining table in the full stocked kitchen and more!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to this charming neighbourhood in Dieppe! This quiet and peaceful cul-de-sac offers a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life, while still being conveniently located near all the amenities you need.

Take a stroll along the tree-lined streets and enjoy the beauty of the well-maintained gardens and lawns. Stroll around Dieppe Market, or head over to Dieppe Rotary Park or Irishtown Nature Park. For those who enjoy outdoor activities, you could also visit the Magnetic Hill Zoo or explore the history of the area at the New Brunswick Aviation Museum or the Dieppe Military Museum.

The neighborhood is also home to several great restaurants and cafes, where you can enjoy a delicious meal or a refreshing drink. With its perfect balance of serenity and convenience, this is the ideal destination for your next getaway!
host_about: Three years ago, my husband Charles and I quit our corporate jobs to become full-time Airbnb hosts, and since taking the leap we've never looked back! We love what we do! Hosting allows us to help others in areas we're really passionate about - travel and real estate - while giving us quality time to spend with our two little ones at home.

name: Chalet de bord de mer
neighborhood_overview: Available 4 seasons. Located on the edge of the famous Baie des Chaleurs, the Acadian town of Beresford (Belle Baie) offers a way of life connected with nature. Sunrises over the sea, beach walks, beating, local fauna, and local flora are all attractions of this small locality. The salt marsh interpretation center of the Baie des Chaleur and the municipal beach are a must-see for those who want to get to know the area better. Several activities are offered in summer: yoga, oversized bike rental, kayaks and paddle boards. Close to the town of Bathurst, you can drive there in a few minutes. Bathurst and surrounding towns including Nigadoo and Petit Rocher among others, have several grocery stores, pharmacies, and everything you'll need. Also, several cream shops,  restaurants with a varied menu and charming shops. Seafood and seafood are part of our menu every time you stay.
host_about: Nous sommes deux soeurs, Marielle et Lise, Co-propriétaires de ce lieu de rêve. Il a été construit par nos parents lorsque nous étions toutes mini et nous venons de le prendre en charge. Lise et moi sommes des artistes et des passionnées de jardinage. On a un amour commun pour la couleur.  Nous adorons les baignades matinales dans la Baie des Chaleurs ravigotante, le poisson et les fruits de mer!

name: Winter at Taffy Lake
description: A tranquil cabin in nature.  You may have the entire lake to yourself.  A short walk or snow shoe in might be required.  After a short walk, a charming, rustic cabin in the woods awaits.  This lakefront cottage is a quiet oasis in the winter, a place of peace and tranquility to unwind in nature.  Just a few minutes (20 minutes) away from ski Crabbe Mountain and accessible by snowmobile.
neighborhood_overview: Taffy Lake is a remote spot that is definitely for the adventurous sort. During ice storms and frigid temperatures we may have to cancel your stay. It can and does get brutal at the lake. However, it is also peaceful and serene and we love it there.
host_about:
Our family is local and has enjoyed our time on this lake for years. There are only about six cottages on our end of the lake, so it is quiet and tranquil.  It's a great place to come and reconnect with your family and with nature.  The cottage itself is a bit quirky in design, it’s had four separate owners after all.
Our cottage includes the use of kayaks, canoe, pedal boat, fire pit area including firewood, bbq, etc. at no additional charge.

name: The Cozy Cottage at Parlee Beach
description: Relax with the whole family at this peaceful cozy cottage. Winter rental Oct to May available.---- Located at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac in the popular Bluff area of Pointe-du-Chène, and only a 5 minute walk to Parlee Beach! neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is predominately summer cottages that have been here for generations.  Nestled in the trees with single lane sand roads that intertwine the cottages.  Walking to and from the beach along these sandy lanes is always relaxing and enjoyable.

We are fortunate to now own our own cottage here and since we have limited time to enjoy it ourselves we thought we could offer it to you to make memories of your own.

name: Tsaheylu's Beach House near Parlee Beach
description:
Enjoy this 4 bedroom, 1 .5 bath rustic cottage escape. Within minutes walk to both Parlee Beach & PDC Wharf.

After a day at the beach, Enjoy evenings on the back deck, cuddle up to a book or let the family games begin.

Parlee Beach is known for having the warmest salt water north of West Virginia. The wharf offers seasonal shops, restaurants and boat cruises. Many close by bike trails.

A 5 min drive to Shediac, lobster capital of the world, including restaurants and groceries
neighborhood_overview:
Parlee Beach is known for having the warmest salt water north of West Virginia. Amenities at the provincial beach include foot rise off stations, volleyball courts, kids play ground and seasonal canteen. (check their website for more details).

The PDC wharf offers seasonal shops, restaurants and boat cruises.

There are many close by bike and ATV trails.

A 5 min drive to Shediac, lobster capital of the world, including many
great restaurants, grocery stores, Dollar Store and pharmacy.

name: Bell Tent Event Space in Orchard, near Fredericton
description:
In a sprawling, mature-growth apple orchard only 25 minutes from Fredericton is the private, charming, and affordable venue you've been seeking for your group event or wedding.

This venue features a rustic 2 bedroom lodge with 1.5 baths, a kitchen, and large living area. Outdoors you will find 4 bell-tents, 2 transparent event domes, a hot-tub, outdoor fire pits/seating areas, and a field with space for dancing, event tents, and more.

Your event booking helps fund free youth nature retreats!
host_about:
Hello! I am the proud owner of M. Ruth Retreats located at 30 Orchard Lane in Tay Creek, NB. In this beautiful, old-growth apple orchard where I grew up, you will find 3 elegant bell tents, 2 transparent experience domes, and one large event tent. I am excited to share the site with you through so many mediums. 

All excess revenue generated from your booking will fund free youth nature connectivity retreats. Learn more on our website!

Food lovers will be delighted with the abundance of dining options available in the area. From casual cafes to upscale restaurants, you'll find plenty of options to suit your taste. Whether you're in the mood for seafood, international cuisine, or classic Canadian dishes, you'll find plenty of options to choose from.

Outdoor enthusiasts will also love the location, with easy access to local parks and trails that offer beautiful views and plenty of opportunities for exercise and relaxation. Shopping and entertainment are also within easy reach, with a variety of shops, stores, and local attractions located nearby. From unique boutiques to

These stunning cabins set high on the mountainside offer awesome views of the Waterford Valley and have all of the luxuries to keep you cozy.

neighborhood_overview: Our cabins are build on a mountainside with incredible views of the Waterford Valley in the Caledonia Highlands. We are around the corner from Poley Mountain and at the center of the Watervord Valley. There is lots to do in the area. We have cut, built and marked two unique trails. The Flow Trail follows a quiet brook nestled in a valley while the Elevation Trail is a straight climb to the top of the ski resort. There is sightseeing all around and there are many awesome activities and day adventures to be had within a few minutes drive.

name: River Ridge Retreat come play in the water.
description:
Escape to your very own slice of paradise at our charming waterfront cottage on the St. Croix River! If you’re craving some quality family time, this is the perfect retreat for you. Nestled in a serene and private setting, our off-grid cottage offers the ideal atmosphere for relaxation and making unforgettable memories together.

Book your getaway today, and let the adventure begin!
neighborhood_overview:
This cottage provides 2 acres of privacy. Rural but not remote, only 20 minutes from all amenities.
In St. Stephen there is a brewery on the water, border town to Calais Maine.
Hiking, golf, cycling are also within 20 minutes, or one can venture to St. Andrew's by the sea, which is a 45 minute drive.
Boat launch on property and water toys are available.
host_about:
We are a blended family with 5 adult children and 3 grand children. We searched 8 years to find our retirement property. And we are sharing it with like minded individuals who have a love and respect for nature. 
We trust you will enjoy your stay.  May it be equivalent to our years in searching for our dream location, this magical spot.  We could not be happier.  We look forward to hearing about your stay, and  your piece of paradise experience.

name: Glamping on a budget with ocean views!
description:
Enjoy incredible bay views while sipping your coffee and gazing out at the bald eagles. Not to mention, the best sunsets on the East Coast. Our 37' Coachman Catalina sits on an elevated acre of property, overlooking the Bay of Fundy. It has 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, an outdoor kitchen, outdoor bar and shower. This experience will not break the bank. Bring your own towels and linens, or for an extra $35 per night we will provide.
Life is good for friends, family, and fun island vacations!
host_about:
I grew up on Campobello Island and lived out West for close to 20 years.  While living in Arizona my husband and I decided to build a home on the island so we could enjoy island summers and escape the desert heat.  My dad was up for the challenge and he built our home in 2007.  We decided to share our adorable little cottage in 2015 and became super hosts with Air B&B for 4 years.  During Covid I deleted our account so here we are, starting from scratch with Air B&B.  We hope you enjoy our home and the serenity of the island as much as we do.

-Cheers

Treena

name: Stay Awhile - Apartment (upper home) Dalhousie
description: This open concept 1440 square feet upper-level home with attached garage is a perfect spot to host a family, group of friends or simple getaway. The main area has huge windows and knotty pine vaulted ceilings allowing plenty of natural light. Get the best viewing experience with the 86-inch smart television.  Portable wheelchair ramp accessible to access the home (2 steps). The interior is step-free. Enjoy the 1.5 attached garage to store your toys (vehicle, motorbike, snowmobiles, ATV, etc.).
neighborhood_overview:
Just a 3-minute drive to the Inch Aaran area where you will find the Bon Ami Rocks, a saltwater beach, ice cream shop, Recreaplex (gym and indoor public pool), Inch Arran Ice Palace, outdoor playground and more. The snowmobile/ATV trail is nearby.

Recommended activities within 25-km radius
• Les Aventuriers Club, cross-country skiing and snowshoeing.
• Outdoor ice rinks, sledding, walking trails and splash pads (Dalhousie, Charlo, Balmoral, Eel River Dundee).
• Enjoy plenty of activities at the Sugarloaf Provincial Park such as downhill skiing, sliding, ice skating, cross-country skiing, snowshoeing, fat biking and hiking.

Feel free to reach out if you are looking for more recommendations.

Stay a bit or Stay Awhile.
host_about: I love travelling and also own an airbnb in Dalhousie, NB

name: The Green Canoe
description:
Stop in and relax at this quiet country home overlooking the rolling hills of the St. John River valley in Greenfield, New Brunswick. Enjoy a hot drink on a cold night beside the fireplace, stargaze from our chlorine-free hot tub, play a game of dominos, or just take a deep breath of clean country air at The Green Canoe as you paddle through life. There's room for the whole family!

NO smoking/vaping in house or on decks

see guidebook for local attractions

wifi and a 60 inch bluetooth screen
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and helpful
host_about:
We keep busy on our farm raising corn and soybeans together with harvesting crops for other farmers in the area
We also represent one of the 15 egg farmers and farm families of New Brunswick. We help deliver a constant supply of fresh, high-quality, locally produced eggs and together build a sustainable egg industry producing table eggs for future generations.
Taking time to go for a canoe ride and a hamburger fry is also top priority !

name: The Carriage House Loft (on Montague)
description: Stay in June for a special price! Experience beautiful St Andrews by the Sea in a historic carriage house loft designed by Edward Maxwell.  Recently renovated to preserve its timeless structure and provide everything you need for your stay.  Conveniently located just 2 blocks up from Water St, or NBCC, it is a great space for your stay. We have 2 units to pick from. Vaulted ceilings, skylights, open concept living, and fully appointed kitchen await you in this one of a kind living space.
neighborhood_overview: The beautiful historic town of St. Andrews by the Sea is  a quaint waterfront resort town recently voted as on of the best places to visit in Canada. Enjoy local shops, restaurants,  whale watching, Kingsbrae Gardens, Ministers Island, sight-seeing, biking trails, beaches, and so much more!
host_about:
My husband, Greg and I have been married for 29 years, we live here and we love being on the water. We are semi-retired.
We have 3 adult children and 5 grandkids. 
Which are our world. 
We love walking on the beach, going out on canoes, kayaks or boat and seeing the porpoises and seals, boating, fishing and hanging out with our kids and grandchildren.

description:
Main Southwest Miramichi River, Doyles Brook. Boat launch on site. Each camper (4 available) has a queen bed, fold out couch, and a dinette that turns into a double bed as well. Each camper is outfitted with the cooking/eating basics. Bedding, facecloths, and towels are NOT provided. This is not a “glamping” site but more of a camping site.

name: Youghall Beach House, Spectacular Views
description: Need to get away? This charming home is designed for relaxation and rejuvenation. Lounge on the sun deck, walk the beach, enjoy the sandbars and swim in the Bay. This peaceful beachfront home with spectacular views directly on the Bay of Chaleur awaits.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood with fabulous and friendly full-time residents next door on both sides.
host_about: We own 4 beach vacation properties on beautiful Longboat Key and Anna Maria Island, FL. Three are a short walk to Beaches on the Gulf of Mexico, and one is directly on the beach, with many great restaurants and attractions nearby all condos. LBK and AMI are very special places. We stay every weekend and walk the beaches daily (when a property is available, our home is 1 hour north in the Tampa area). We hope you have an opportunity to experience these amazing white sand beaches and enjoy the beauty, serenity, and fun of this special part of Florida's beautiful Gulf Coast. As hosts, we are very attentive and available at any time to assist with anything if needed.

name: Cottage on Queen
description: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. This beautifully updated and well equipped cape cod offers a unique opportunity to stay in a 200 year old cottage located one block from Water Street in downtown Saint Andrews.  With peakaboo views of the harbour from the  gorgeous backyard, a stay at the heritage award-winning Cottage on Queen allows guests to experience first hand all the charm and character of historic Saint Andrews by-the-Sea.

Our cottage will allow you to relax and in the same breath, fully enjoy your family gathering. Our home is 1800sqft and boasts five bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and enough beds to host a family reunion.

Marc is a teacher and I am a proud stay at home mom, working on all my homesteading skills!  We love playing board games together and hanging out over delicious meals!
Our home is a welcoming country-style environment; it makes everyone feel welcome and comfortable!
Welcome to beautiful Davidson Lake!

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the charming city of Moncton! Our property is located in a vibrant and friendly neighborhood that is perfect for those who want to experience all that this wonderful city has to offer.

Food lovers will be delighted with the abundance of dining options available in the area. From casual cafes to upscale restaurants, you'll find plenty of options to suit your taste. Whether you're in the mood for seafood, international cuisine, or classic Canadian dishes, you'll find plenty of options to choose from.

Outdoor enthusiasts will also love the location, with easy access to local parks and trails that offer beautiful views and plenty of opportunities for exercise and relaxation. Take a walk through the lush green spaces or enjoy a picnic with friends and family in one of the area's many public areas.

Shopping and entertainment are also within easy reach, with a variety of shops, stores, and local attractions located nearby. From unique boutiques to l

name: Queen of the Bluff: coastal cottage charm
description:
NEW OWNERS! Significant renovation/style upgrade complete Spring and Summer 2024.

Shediac Gran Fondo riders -- secure bike shed on site!

Steps from Parlee Beach – a 6-minute speedwalk or a 12-minute stroll -- this charming cottage boasts three cozy bedrooms, spacious outdoor dining area, washer/dryer on site for those damp post-beach-day towels, all on a double-lot.

The Queen of the Bluff is an ideal paradise for families of up to 6 people.

STRICT No Smoking / No Parties / No Pets policy.
host_about: Hi there! I'm Mary-Jo. My husband, Chad, and I are avid travellers, and are constantly competing with one another re: who's been to the most countries. He's currently at 22 and I'm lagging behind by two! (Our two little girls have been to seven and five each!) That said, we know what it means to arrive at your destination and be immediately happy with your accommodations. To that end, we aim to make your stay at Queen of the Cove a really great one. We consider ourselves to be genuinely nice people, and will do what we can to ensure you agree! Look forward to meeting you! :)jojo

description:

name: River's Edge - Waterfront Cottage in Saint John
description: Nestled along the serene Saint John River, River's Edge Retreat offers a perfect balance of comfort and tranquility. Located just seconds from Dominion Beach, TimberTop Adventure, and minutes from Uptown Saint John, it’s the ideal destination for relaxation and exploration alike. Designed for families, couples, or solo travelers, this charming retreat features a spacious open-concept living area with large windows that flood the space with natural light and showcase breathtaking river views.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled on a serene cul-de-sac on Randolph Island in Saint John, this neighborhood offers a peaceful retreat just moments away from the delights of Dominion Park. Imagine strolling along soft, sandy beaches, indulging in treats at the Snack Shack, or embarking on thrilling adventures at TimberTop Adventure—all within minutes from your doorstep.

This location is more than just a spot on the map; it's a perfect blend of the tranquility of a cottage getaway and the convenience of urban amenities. Here, you can escape the hustle and bustle of city life while still enjoying easy access to everything Saint John has to offer. Whether you're looking to relax by the water, explore nature trails, or simply unwind in a peaceful environment, Randolph Island provides an idyllic setting.

Experience the charm of this neighborhood, where you can enjoy the best of both worlds—city proximity without compromising on the serenity of island living.
host_about:
hello, I'm passionate about meeting new people, hosting, exploring, building connections, and growing.

As a host, I strive to provide a welcoming and comfortable environment, ensuring every stay is special and memorable!
As a guest, I respect every property and enjoy experiencing local cultures. When I'm not hosting or traveling, I love hiking, cooking, spending time with family & friends. I look forward to making memorable experiences together!

neighborhood_overview:
Parlee Beach: Located within a 5-minute walking distance, Parlee Beach is a must-visit destination. With its pristine sandy beaches and warm waters, it's an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, and beachside picnics. Enjoy beach volleyball, build sandcastles, or take a leisurely stroll along the shoreline. The beach also offers amenities like changing rooms, washrooms, and a canteen for your convenience!

The Point-du-Chene Wharf and Restaurants: Located near Parlee Beach, within a 5-minute walking distance the Wharf is a charming waterfront area bustling with activity. Explore a variety of local restaurants that serve up delicious seafood dishes, from freshly caught lobster and oysters to mouthwatering fish and chips. Enjoy picturesque views of the marina as you savour your meal. Take a leisurely walk along the wharf, watching the fishing boats come and go, or browse through the quaint shops offering unique local crafts and souvenirs. The Wharf is the perfect place to immers
