name: Ocean Views in a Central Location
description: You will be close to everything when you stay in this centrally located home, with a view of the Atlantic Ocean's Bay of Fundy and the Partridge Island lighthouse, located just two blocks from Bayshore Beach, a block from the Carleton Martello Tower national historic landmark and a short jaunt to both Reversing Falls and Saint John's famous Uptown.  With a mix of vintage and whimsical appointments, experience all-new appliances and fixtures in this colourful and incredible place.
neighborhood_overview: Bayshore began being developed in the 1870s and continued through the 1940s.  'Our neighbourhood faces the ocean, is abutted by a small fortress from the War of 1812, and is skirted by a freight line railway, whose trains chug through occasionally and which features a pathway that stretches from just above Bayshore Beach to McLaren's Beach, along bountiful flora and incredible rock formations.   Further down the street is a small graveyard whose earliest interments go back to the 1800s.  On the far reaches of the neighbourhood are the remains of Fort Dufferin.   The area is often foggy and can be quite windy due to its proximity to the ocean, but is nonetheless beautiful - especially on starry nights where you can see almost forever.

Renovated 2 bedroom chalet, ideal for an all-season getaway! Clean and welcoming, it can accommodate up to 4 people and is a 5-minute walk from the beach.

neighborhood_overview:
Cap-Bimet in Grand-Barachois is a picturesque neighborhood that offers a peaceful living environment, ideal for those looking for tranquility near the sea. With stunning ocean views and sandy beaches, it's a perfect spot to relax and enjoy nature.

The neighborhood is also close to local shops, restaurants, and recreational activities. You can explore coastal trails, practice water sports, or just enjoy walks by the water.

Cap-Bimet is a perfect destination for outdoor enthusiasts and those who want to get away from the urban hustle and bustle, while remaining accessible to the main tourist attractions of the region.

name: Destination Trailer by the Sea
description:
Escape to the tranquility of the Baie des Chaleurs and unwind in our cozy trailer. This charming little home away from home is the perfect spot for a peaceful getaway.

Bookings are only available from June to October and must be for a seven nights during from Saturday to Saturday.
host_about: Hi! We were both born and raised in small towns in Northern Ontario and New Brunswick. We moved to Ottawa to attend the University of Ottawa and stayed as we loved this beautiful city. We met much later when we had established careers and bought a lovely home in the rural outskirts of Ottawa. We love team sports (softball, hockey, and volleyball) as well as individual sports (golf and tennis). We're laidback and love the outdoors.  We enjoy hiking and skiing and that is what drew us to buy a beautiful quaint property in the Adirondacks in 2019. We've been hosting since November 2019, and truly enjoy sharing our space and love for this community and area. Although we live far from our second home, we love chatting with our guest and take pride in being readily available for any questions, recommendations, and concerns. We would be honoured to share our cozy home with you!

name: Suite stay in Uptown Saint John.
description:
Welcome to your centrally located 3-bedroom suite in the heart of uptown Saint John. The James Peters Residence is the oldest brownstone Neoclassical building located in Saint John, built in 1827. It is recognized for its architecture and association with the Loyalist Peters family and its descendents.
With the City Market, restaurants, Kings Square, pubs, shops and numerous art galleries within walking distance you won’t run out of things to do. Offstreet parking is included.

name: Pointe-du-Chêne: Parlee Cottage
description: This quaint 4-bedroom (3 in main building, plus Bunk House Room: 5 beds, sleeps 8) cottage in Pointe-du-Chêne is only a 5-minute walk to Parlee Beach and minutes from Shediac. Our rustic family-style cottage is highlighted by its open concept layout, unique screened-in gazebo (perfect for dining & relaxing day and night bug-free—rain or shine), Bunk House (w/queen bed) and backyard—with fire pit. The large windows, pine walls & traditional cottage feel make for a cozy ambiance!
host_about: When travelling, I like to experiencing living authentically — like the locals. When welcoming vacationers into my space, I try to present a space that reflects the local culture and the experience of those that live and play in the area.
